We are looking for a passionate Backend Developer to help us build and maintain our product. If you want to work with Elixir, work well in cross-functional teams, and value contributing to a highly diverse team, we want to hear from you!

Gross annual compensation range for the role is 60,000-65,000 EUR plus some great benefits.

About Toggl Plan

Toggl Plan is a multicultural and diverse team of 15 people from all around the world.

Our product fosters transparency in work, and we practice what we preach‚Äîboth internally and externally. We are dedicated towards creating a work atmosphere where it's natural to be open, honest, evolving, and efficient.

As part of Toggl, we are building a complementary tool to the world-famous time tracker: a visual team calendar that helps project teams know who's doing what and when in seconds. We are squarely focused on small-to-medium-sized companies, helping them reduce stress when dealing with deadlines, people's availability, and ever-changing project requirements.

In collaboration with Toggl Track, our goal is to build healthier workplaces by offering teams simple and easy tools to eliminate stress at work.

Responsibility

  • Develop our product as part of cross-functional product teams
  • Build and maintain our backend applications and our growing infrastructure
  • Optimize performance and stability of our product
  • Experiment with new technologies to improve our product and experience as a team

Requirements

  • Familiar with all stages of web application development (design, implementation, testing)
  • Significant experience with back-end development
  • Experience with Elixir, PostgreSQL, Git and Unix
  • Experience with AWS, Docker, Ansible and Terraform is a plus
  • Comfortable working on a fully remote team, with good written communication and willingness to actively collaborate with other remote team members
  • Value contributing to a respectful, open, transparent, multicultural, and evolving company culture

Who you work with and how

You will be the 10th member of our engineering team, working alongside other backend, frontend, and mobile developers.

We lay out our growth strategy for 6 months at a time, pick projects that take us towards our goals every 6 weeks, and then execute accordingly while keeping everyone in the loop with thoughtful, asynchronous communication.

You will report directly to Iuri, our Engineering Lead.

Benefits

  • The gross annual compensation range for this role is 60,000-65,000 EUR
  • Freedom to choose when and where you work, as long as you are available a few hours a day between 07:00-15:00 UTC
  • 24 days of paid time off a year, plus your local holidays
  • In-person meetups for team-building (expenses covered)
  • 4-6 weeks paid sabbatical (depending on the tenure of the employee)
  • Laptop and a ‚Ç¨2,000 budget to set up your home office
  • Reimbursement for co-working space membership or internet service at home
  • ‚Ç¨4,000 contribution for training, workshops, and conferences
  • Health (physical and mental) budget of 2,000‚Ç¨ per year
  • Support for buying tools you need for doing your best work (even eyeglasses if you need a new pair)

Be sure to mention the word MODESTY when applying to show you read the job post completely. This is a beta feature to avoid spam applicants. Companies can search these words to find applicants that read this and see they're human.

Salary and compensation

$60,000 ‚Äî $70,000/year

Location

üåè Worldwide

Basecamp is hiring a Content Marketing Manager to organize, edit, and write content for our website, social media, and other channels.

About the Work
At Basecamp, we value the written word. Maybe we‚Äôre old school, but we think that especially in today‚Äôs world of bullet points and tweets, there‚Äôs a lot of skill and art in communicating well. 

We‚Äôre looking for a content manager and writer who has a flair for translating ideas into everyday language and compelling storylines. 

In this role you will:
  • Oversee content production and develop a web content strategy that syncs with our brand marketing and demand generation goals.
  • Create, edit, and manage content for a variety of mediums that could include: email, newsletters, blogs, white papers/guides, thought leadership articles, customer case studies, website pages, webinar slide decks, sales collateral, event collateral, and video scripts.
  • Utilize SEO tactics to help improve domain authority and natural search results by incorporating high value keywords into new articles, optimizing target keywords in existing articles, and securing backlinks.
  • Maintain the master content calendar that schedules all aspects of the creation and delivery of content throughout the year.
  • Stay up-to-date with current best practices in the industry for tactics that might apply to us.
  • Collaborate with the team on content for social media posts.
  • Help maintain a consistent voice and tone for the brand across multiple channels.
About You
  • You have 5+ years experience writing and editing (in English) for multiple channels, and can articulate the differences in how you approach them.
  • You‚Äôre a stickler for style, grammar and finding the words and phrases that best capture and idea or feeling.
  • You have deep experience with SEO and keyword strategy. You're familiar with tools such as AHREFS or SEMRush to monitor competitive positioning and identify new opportunities.
  • You have some technical proficiency with CMS tools such as WordPress. 
  • You‚Äôve managed freelance writers, and may even have a short list that you‚Äôve worked with before. 
  • You‚Äôre equally comfortable and motivated by working ‚Äúhigh level,‚Äù developing a strategy and plan, or being ‚Äùhands-on‚Äù writing and editing.
  • The Basecamp ‚Äúvoice‚Äù and tone resonates with you, and is easy for you to adopt. 
  • You‚Äôre comfortable as a manager of one. 
You approach your work with a spirit of partnership and collaboration, not exclusion or rigidness. You're a resourceful problem solver; you can feel for gaps in what you're working on, pitch solutions and implement them. 

This is a fully remote position. Since we're a remote company, you'll find that the bulk of everyone's work is written, whether that's long form posts or chats with your co-workers. We value people who can take a stand yet commit when they disagree. We subject ideas to rigorous debate, but all remember that we're here for the same purpose: to do good work together. Charging the trust battery is part of that work.

We encourage applicants from all backgrounds and identities to apply for a job where you can do the best work of your career. Basecamp is committed to remaining a calm company where we don't regularly work longer than 40 hours per week and take proper vacations.

What To Expect
You can expect a mindful onboarding process with structured ramp-up time. You can expect a team that listens. You can expect to be counted on and the freedom to do your best work. We build our apps, our teams, and our company for the long haul, so you can build your career here if you choose to.

We respect everyone's right to participate in political expression and activism, but avoid having political debates on our internal communication systems. Basecamp as a company also does not weigh in on politics publicly, outside of topics directly related to our business. You should be at peace with both of these stances.

Pay and benefits
Basecamp pays in the top 10% of the industry, for the matched role and experience, based on San Francisco rates. The salary for this role is $126,250. No matter where you live. Plus, with two years under your belt, you‚Äôll participate in our profit-sharing program.

Our benefits support a life well-lived away from work. Ample time off and all the resources you need to support you in doing the best work of your career. Here's more on the benefitswe offer.

Applicants from outside the US will be offered a contractor role with comparable terms and at the same rate of pay as our US-based employees.

How to apply
Please send an application tailored to this position that speaks to us. Introduce yourself to us as a colleague. Within your cover letter, give us some examples of some of your best written work, how it was used and to what effect. We would like to see a resume, but forget that generic resume. Show us what really sets you apart! 

Go for it!
We are accepting applications for this position until Friday, March 4, 2022, at 5:00PM US-Central time.

You should not expect to hear for a few weeks, while we review all applications. Please note that we‚Äôre unable to offer individual feedback during the screening process. We usually see hundreds of applications for roles, and our small hiring team simply doesn‚Äôt have the bandwidth to offer personalized feedback before the interview stage.

Interviews will take place in March. Expect 2-3 interviews over the course of a few weeks. Our interviews are conversations held with future colleagues ‚Äì no tests, no surprises. After that, we'll ask the final candidates to complete an at-home written exercise. We hope to extend an offer in April, with a flexible start date later that month.

We look forward to hearing from you!

APPLY HERE

Salary: Dependent on location and experience
Location: Full time remote working

Cipher Corp Ltd (SPYSCAPE) is an innovative entertainment technology company, seeking a superstar Digital Project Manager to join our international team and help us expand our SPYSCAPE brand ecosystem.

About SPYSCAPE

SPYSCAPE is a fast-growing premium brand that creates stories and experiences to inspire people to discover their superpowers and their inner superheroes. 

In the physical world, SPYSCAPE HQ in New York City is the #1 rated new experience in New York City. It features seven core experiential zones and recently created the first ever official James Bond exhibition in the USA.

In the digital world, we‚Äôre now creating a new mobile experiences platform that combines interactive narratives with geolocative adventures. These play out in real-time (like the TV series 24), in the real-world (like PokemonGo!). We have also built a unique skills assessment methodology and scoring algorithm to illuminate individual personality, skills and attributes. Developed with top psychologists and a former Head of Training at British Intelligence, this program gives people an inspiring detailed dossier of their own attributes and potential - check it out here


Role Description

We are seeking a customer-centric Senior Project Manager with a proven track record of taking ownership and delivering results in a fast-paced, dynamic environment. You‚Äôd join our team of experienced developers and make an immediate impact by building products that will support our business as we continue to scale. In this role, you will work with our core team of engineers and designers, while working cross-functionally with marketers and customers to define, build, and launch mission-critical initiatives. We need someone creative and strategic to guide the team as they develop features, collaborate to make challenging decisions, prioritise the right things, solve problems, and ensure we are shipping exceptionally high-quality products.

If you have the knack and the desire to build impactful products, we want you on our team!

Due to the remote nature of this role, we are unable to provide visa sponsorship. The ideal candidate will be in a time zone no more than 2-3 hours different to London. Resumes and communication must be submitted in English.


Key values we are looking for:
  • Adaptable, responsive, proactive, articulate, efficient, team player

Responsibilities:
  • Own and lead all aspects of an established agile team, including backlog grooming, triage and prioritisation.
  • Responsible for defining the scope of development for new product features, ongoing feature improvements including management of all backlog and project management activities.
  • Write and prioritise user stories and define acceptance criteria.
  • Analytical ability to break down complex problems and efficiently use data and analytics layered against high-quality user research to inform the direction of the products.
  • Ability to establish and maintain a high level of credibility with internal and external partners.
  • Track progress, assess risks, coordinate delivery, and actively communicate contingency and mitigation plans for the team.
  • Management and implementation of changes to our Webflow website.

In the first week, expect to:
  • Onboard and integrate into our culture, studying and learning the SPYSCAPE product suite while working with our existing senior PM.
  • Get to know your colleagues and the current projects in flight.

In the first month, expect to:
  • Work cross-functionally and with Senior PM to organise and prioritise your high-level roadmap and backlog.
  • Start collaborating closely with the development and marketing teams.

In the first three months, expect to:
  • Ship features that deliver high business impact.
  • Be fully embedded into and owning a development team.
  • Take over all in-flight and planned initiatives.
  • Monitor and measure the success of your initiatives against company goals.
  • Continuously improve the team‚Äôs processes through meaningful contributions.

In the first year, expect to:
  • Deliver on the roadmap priorities and promises.
  • Ensure your team has an incredible record of building impactful products in a timely and elegant fashion.
  • Work cross-functionally to scale your team to meet the growing needs of our business and our users.

Requirements:
  • At least 5 years of proven tech project management experience.
  • Ability to creatively craft solutions through data and a customer-centric approach.
  • Ability to build wireframes and mockups, with an aptitude for keeping things simple.
  • Be meticulous and have a high bar for quality when writing user stories, reviewing designs, brainstorming technical approaches, and testing a feature before it is released.
  • Be comfortable being hands-on with implementation of product and web updates
  • Be humble, willing to learn, and do whatever is needed to help us accomplish our goals.
  • Outstanding written and verbal communication skills.
  • Experience using agile development methodologies with globally distributed teams and the ability to keep up with a fast-paced company.
  • You must be an active contributor to thrive at SPYSCAPE. You will not be here just to tell other people what to do!

The role is restricted to those physically located in Europe. While this is a remote position, we cannot consider candidates that are not based in Europe.


As a Full Stack developer, you will be part of our remote but tightly knit dev team, working closely with Product Leads to launch new websites, maintain existing products, and improve performance across our whole inventory of digital assets.


Our team is made up of diverse individuals, from various parts of the world, coming together to deliver quality software, help each other grow and at the end of the day be proud of the work we are doing.


Here at #teamraketech we create high performance solutions for our partners in the iGaming industry.

To do this we need your help further developing our in-house CMS built with React, NextJS, Node & headless WordPress.

You may find the role requirements below, but even if you think you don‚Äôt meet all the criteria but would still be interested in the job, please apply! Nobody checks every box. We prefer working with individuals with a good cultural fit, helping them develop in the areas where they might not be so strong in (provided they are interested in doing so).


What does the role entail? 

  • Code and deliver quality software
  • Identify the causes of reported issues and implement the respective fixes
  • Implement both backend and front-end features
  • Coordinate with UX/UI designers, developers and test engineers in an Agile environment
  • Perform impact assessment of features and defects with Product Owner
  • Share and promote your ideas towards the improvement of the products and the business
  • Abide by industry and company software development standards
  • Help and provide guidance to junior developers

Job description

Firestone Walker Brewing Company
Firestone Walker Brewing Company began as a small brewery with roots in the wine country on California‚Äôs Central Coast. Now a regional craft brewery, our singular purpose remains ‚Äì to craft the world‚Äôs best beers. Passionately in pursuit of the perfect beer‚Ä¶ and never satisfied

Job Summary:
As an Art Director on the Venice Brand Design team, you‚Äôll lead the strategic development and execution of multichannel creative initiatives for ad campaigns (including, but not limited to), social/digital, packaging, film, retail, experiential, product branding, and marketing projects from start to finish. You‚Äôre a conceptual problem solver and design leader with fluency in creating visual concepts and storytelling to communicate ideas that inspire, inform, and engage with consumers. You will own the creative process and visual ID for key brand categories working with the Head of Creative, marketing partners, and external creative teams to develop innovative creative material for FWBC products and marketing campaigns.

Essential Job Duties and Responsibilities:
Specifically, the responsibilities of the position include, but are not limited to, the following activities:
- Develop world class creative and produce 360 multi-channel campaigns that get results
- Gather cross functional alignment and sell-in concepts to leadership
- Oversee production and execution of all creative aspects in collaboration with production teams and external partners across all formats and deliverables
- Develop and execute design projects across all channels
- Direct and manage photoshoots, video, and film productions
- Contribute to elevating and advancing overall FWBC aesthetic that meets band guidelines
- Cross-functional relationship building and partnership to ensure strategic progression, improvement, and consistency
- Translate product positioning, data, and marketing strategies into strategic ideas and design solutions
- Maintain creative experience for digital and CRM to ensure creative alignment, usability, engagement, and growth
- Stay up to date on cultural and design trends as well as potential creative partners who are pushing the look and capabilities of what‚Äôs current
- Cultivate team growth through mentorship and leading by example
- Collaborate with all team members to ensure progression, improvement and consistency

Required Qualifications:
- Bachelor‚Äôs Degree or 6+ years in a marketing or related field
- Proven track record in creating world class creative campaigns
- Highly collaborative approach, with experience in a fast-paced and cross-functional focused environment
- Strong ability to strategically include outside functional expertise and performance data into your creative solutions
- Expert knowledge of the Adobe Creative Suite with focus on Photoshop, Illustrator, InDesign, Keynote, and a familiarity with and understanding of video editing
- Experience leading photo shoots, video shoots, and all associated pre-production components
- Experience managing and delivering multiple projects in parallel
- Hands-on creative who is willing to make as well as lead projects
- Finger on the pulse of current design and youth culture trends including: graphic and motion design, photography, music, sports, art, and fashion
- Must be driven to bring big ideas to life and passionate for the brand
- Must reside in Los Angeles county, CA

What Firestone Walker Offers:
- Competitive pay rate for an experienced individual with the right skills.
- An excellent benefits package including:
- 100% paid premiums for employee including medical, dental, vision, & life insurance
- Accrued PTO (rate of 13 days per year)
- Accrued Sick Leave (1 hour for every 30 hours worked) 24 hours max usage per year
- 401(k) retirement plan including company paid profit sharing & 4% matching
- 8 paid holidays per year

Please submit your cover letter and resume with your work experience when applying.

Firestone Walker is an Equal Opportunity Employer.

Shareup is the easiest, fastest way to securely share anything with anyone. We help teams collect, organize, and make sense of the myriad of files, links, and services they use to get their work done everyday. Sharing is currently too difficult and stressful! We are obsessed with relieving that stress and anxiety.

We are a design-led company. We define design as ‚Äúhow it works.‚Äù This includes everyone having an overview of the tech fundamentals, understanding the full experience flow for the customer, and contributing to the beautiful details of everything we make‚Äîfrom UIs to code to icons to all the assets and interfaces our customers see and touch.

We are a fully remote team.

You will:

  • Work alongside the founding team to build, test, and maintain a progressive web app and its services with a very modern tech stack.
  • Contribute to the growth of the company through consistently shipping updates while continually receiving and addressing customer feedback.
  • Internalize company goals and make strategic decisions based on them.
  • Create a pleasant working environment that inspires everyone to do their best work.
  • Foster an environment where engineers are productive, happy, and developing their careers and skill sets.
Requirements:

  • You have a portfolio of work that highlights projects demonstrating experience crafting digital experiences and showcases your engineering skills and strengths.
  • You are an expert at receiving and incorporating feedback.
  • You have excellent communication skills.
  • You are optimistic and able to operate in ambiguous or changing situations.
  • You support your decisions with feedback and data.
  • You nurture talent and give people the opportunity to excel.
  • You lead by example and contribute to the customer-facing work.
Helpful attributes:

  • You have experience working on an all-remote team.
  • You have experience building teams/organizations from the ground up.
  • You have experience shaping and leading the Web strategy.
  • You care about and have experience creating accessible web interfaces and applications.
  • You care about every last gzip‚Äôed kb transferred to a browser and the time it takes to parse and run.
  • You have experience coordinating, directing, and guiding the work of other engineers.
  • You have experience building Web interfaces and solutions for many platforms and OS‚Äôs.
Why you‚Äôll enjoy working at Shareup:

  • You‚Äôll have the opportunity to build a product that really improves people‚Äôs ability to collaborate while also reducing their stress and anxiety.
  • You‚Äôll work at a company that believes in personal empowerment and responsibility.
  • You‚Äôll receive competitive compensation and stock options.
  • You‚Äôll benefit from flexible hours, vacation, and coworkers who understand the value of taking time off to recharge and the need to prioritize family obligations.

ADDITIVE is looking for a self-driven, experienced Backend Developer with a passion for web technologies and has experience in designing complex backend architectures with Laravel.

Who We Are

At ADDITIVE, we unleash the full potential of hotel distribution by creating software that sets online marketing on autopilot. Our fully automated data-driven solution optimizes occupancy, attracts the ideal guest, increases customer loyalty and drives revenue - all while making the customer independent of intermediaries, such as OTAs.

The Role

The Backend Developer will work on a team of ADDITIVE backend developers, frontend developers, designers and stakeholders in order to understand requirements and collaborate on solutions, as well as feature development. The ideal candidate is self-driven, team-oriented, enthusiastic about web technologies and industry best practices and is experienced in working on Laravel production apps.

Responsibilities

  • Developing backend web applications and API‚Äôs with Laravel
  • Connection of external systems and interfaces, including the processing of large amounts of data
  • Writing maintainable, well-documented code with extensive test coverage
  • Responsibility for features together with the team consisting of frontend developers and designers
  • Exchange of experience and knowledge transfer within the department
  • Research and evaluation of new technologies, innovations and trends
  • Driving force for new creative ideas and technical solutions

Must Haves

  • Several years of experience in the development of applications using a PHP framework
  • Good knowledge of database and SQL (PostgreSQL)
  • Well-founded knowledge of interfaces (REST, JSON, XML)
  • High demand for quality and innovation, especially analytical capabilities
  • Sense of responsibility and reliability
  • Proactive and goal-oriented working
  • Willingness to engage in dialogue and work in teams
  • Interest in technologies, innovation and trends
  • Good English or German language skills are necessary

Nice To Haves

  • Previous remote working experience
  • Experience with Ruby and Ruby on Rails

Perks & Benefits

  • Flexible working hours
  • Annual grant for books, conferences and training
  • Independent and self-reliant work

Employment Type

  • Full-time

Experience Level

  • Mid-Level

Location


This is a remote role, but we are only hiring within Europe. This is to enable timezone alignment and occasional physical meetups in the future.

Paymentology is looking for an experienced PostgreSQL Database Administrator to join our global Infrastructure & Security team. You will be responsible for supporting Paymentology's data operations and infrastructure, underlying all of our products. 

We work in a fast-paced, regulated, and global company that will require you to work collaboratively with all our teams to help get things done. If you are someone who loves to multitask, prioritise and shows initiative then this role will be for you.

What you get to do:
The main priority will be to manage our database environments proactively and as we continue our growth you will also play a key role in ensuring scalability of our data layer systems:
  • You will ensure the availability and performance of the databases that support our systems, ensuring that the associated hardware resources are allocated to the databases and have high resilience and performance tuning.
  • You will proactively monitor the database systems to ensure secure services with minimum downtime and improve maintenance of the databases to include rollouts and upgrades.
  • You will create and maintain technical documentation using defined technical documentation templates, as well as gaining an in-depth knowledge of the business data so you can propose and implement effective solutions.
  • You will work within a structured and agile development approach. 

What it takes to succeed:
  • 5 Years of experience with administrating PostgreSQL Databases in Linux environments. 
  • Experience with setting up, monitoring and maintaining PostgreSQL instances. 
  • A good understanding of Write-Ahead Logging and disaster recovery processes. 
  • Experience with the PostgreSQL backup and restore processes. 
  • Experience with EnterpriseDB.
  • Experience working with Azure, AWS or Oracle Cloud. 
Bonus skills are:
  • Experience implementing and maintaining data warehouses. 
  • Experience with Azure Database for PostgreSQL or AWS RDS for PostgreSQL. 

You are someone who can respond quickly in a fast-paced environment, is intellectually curious and has a passion for continuous learning and growing professionally.

Flexible hours are a must for our remote team. You‚Äôll need to be able to occasionally shift your work hours to participate into on-call duties and better align with global colleagues for the scope of specific projects.

What you can look forward to:

At Paymentology we value making a difference to the lives of the people who work for us and who live in the communities where we operate. As values are important to us, you can look forward to working alongside fellow Paymentologists, who share these values. You‚Äôll be part of a team that is passionate about making a difference on a global scale.

We focus on building strong, diverse teams built from different backgrounds,  experiences & identities.

AmaZix‚Äôs PR and Marketing division handles day to day operations of community management, social media content creation, long form and visual content creation for various blogs and news sites (i.e.: earned media, paid content, Medium), in addition to marketing research, strategies, and ongoing implementation (i.e.: viral giveaways, contests, email drip campaigns, etc).

Now is your chance to become the newest team member of the PR and Marketing division of AmaZix. 

Applicants should be prepared to work in an online remote environment, utilizing Telegram, Discord, and Zoho Projects for collaboration and work assignments, and are expected to learn and become well versed in multiple projects being represented by AmaZix

This is a fully remote 40-hours per week, Monday through Friday full-time position in EU time zones. Salary for this position is $2500 USD per month with a 30 day probationary period that pays $1000 USD. Applications are considered in the order they were submitted, and they don't expire. You'll only be reached out to if selected for an interview.



Requirements

Responsibilities


  • Engage in Strategic Planning to improve brand awareness, engage social communities, drive traffic and leads to clients websites. 
  • Extensive knowledge of social media platform inner workings, efficiency workflows, and platform limitations. 
  • Comfortable establishing look-a-like audiences, setting geographic and demographic filters on common ad platforms
  • Must have sharp knowledge of Onpage, Off Page SEO & CRO Techniques
  • Excellent working knowledge of common SEO tools (Ahrefs, Screaming Frog, Semrush, Google Analytics, Google Search Console, KeywordsTools.io, Hotjar) 
  • Must be familiar with all the PPC Platforms
  • Native Advertising, Programmatic & Other Digital Marketing Channels will be Plus Point
  • Must be able to receive and process your own payments in USDT/USDC/DAI
  • Have a ERC-20 private wallet


Qualifications


  • Self-starter, ability to remain focused and work diligently 100% remote from home with minimal management direction
  • Strong, professional written and verbal communication skills in English (REQUIRED)
  • Past experience in digital marketing, PPC, and SEO workflows (min. 2 years experience or more. Please list references when submitting a resume.)
  • Must be familiar with Facebook Business Manager, Twitter Business Insights, Ads Manager, and preferred experience with Zoho, Telegram, Slack, and Google Products
  • Ability and confidence to manage a minimum of 8 - 12 accounts on a monthly basis
  • Excellent knowledge of cryptocurrency trends
  • Ability to work independently, under pressure, and in a fast paced changing environment
  • Be responsive and respect deadlines while taking the initiative to create own deadlines and expectations for supporting team and client
  • Intensive time management in order to complete tasks on one's own time schedule
  • Ability to work well in a collaborative environment
  • Strong interpersonal skills and a team player with a positive attitude and eagerness to learn
  • Time management: the ability to multitask and prioritize deadlines
  • Maintain a good level of design quality and strong work ethic
  • Willing to contribute and work as a team



Benefits
Enjoy working remotely with a diverse team in a challenging and changing market segment. Company culture promotes and encourages out of the box solutions and new ideas. Get the chance to learn new Blockchain projects early in their development period before they come to market.

Senior Node Js Developer
 
We are looking for a highly capable Node.js developer to join our tech team. You will be collaborating with our developers and product team to accomplish high performance and optimized products by writing testable, reusable, and efficient code.

What you will do :

Developing, Testing, and deploying Back-End of our Products, Bots, and services.

As the Node.js Developer, your primary focus will be the development of server-side logic, definition, and optimization of databases, and ensuring high performance and responsiveness of requests from the front-end.

You may also be responsible for integrating the front-end elements built by your co-workers into the application. This position will also need understanding and experience developing, testing, and documenting database services and ETL tasks. Therefore, a good understanding of front-end technologies is necessary as well.

Completely Remote job which can be done by home.


Technologies you must know:
  • Extensive knowledge of JavaScript ES6, web stacks, libraries, and frameworks.
  • At least three years of experience as a Node.js developer.
  • Proficient understanding of Node.js development in a serverless microservice architecture
  • Proficient understanding of NestJS & Express.js
  • Experience in Redis integration with NodeJS
  • Experience in using TypeScript.
  • Experience with common API formats (e.g., JSON, XML, Websockets)
  • Extensive knowledge of both Relational and No SQL Databases (e.g., MongoDB, PostgreSQL, MySQL)
  • Ability to write well-designed, testable, reusable, and efficient code using software development best practices and patterns.

Technologies you should know:
  • Experience working with Amazon Web Services (ECS, ALB, S3, RDS, Lambda, SQS, ‚Ä¶)
  • Basic Understanding of React.js and state managers like Redux Toolkit or MobX State Tree is an advantage.
  • Knowledge in Docker / Docker Swarm / Kubernetes and Jenkins is an advantage.
Skills :
  • Database Design
  • Security
  • Superb interpersonal, communication, and collaboration skills.
  • Exceptional analytical and problem-solving aptitude.
  • Great organizational and time management skills.
  • Availability to resolve urgent web application issues outside of business hours

Responsibilities :
  • Developing and maintaining all server-side network components.
  • Collaborating with front-end developers on the integration of elements.
  • Develop back-end services for various business processes.
  • Developing high-performance applications by writing testable, reusable, and efficient code.
  • Implementing effective security protocols, data protection measures, and storage solutions.
  • Running diagnostic tests, repairing defects, and providing technical support.
  • Documenting Node.js processes as well as preparing reports.
  • Recommending and implementing improvements to processes and technologies.
  • Keeping informed of advancements in the field of Node.js development.

Salary:  Negotiable
About us: https://www.ai-bees.io/about-us

We are a fast-growing company providing lead generation services to global companies. 
Our headquarters is located in Hamburg, Germany and we also have an office at San Francisco, United States. We have around 150 Employees from 23 Countries. You can visit our website to know more about us: www.ai-bees.io/about-us

results.role: Business Development Rep #1 at Fast Growth YC Startup
results.text:
About the job

Great Question is hiring our first Business Development Representatives to help us on our mission to democratize user research - helping companies talk to their customers more to ensure they build software that people want!

We're a well-funded seed-stage startup, backed by Y Combinator and Funders Club, looking for a experienced Business Development Representatives to join our high performing, fast-paced, and fully remote team.

This is a huge opportunity to get in early, work with an innovative product our customers love, and shape the future of how teams build software through research.

This is a remote role open to anyone able to work within American timezones.

Who we're looking for

We're looking for someone with proven experience in a Business Development role, preferably for an SMB or enterprise-grade SaaS.

You‚Äôll need the following skillsets to be successful in this role:

  • 1+ year of outbound sales experience (Sales Development Representative experience works too!) with a quota in a SaaS environment - including cold calling & cold emailing
  • Self-driven & competitive (you don‚Äôt need anyone to motivate you)
  • Resourceful - you can run through walls to find a way to achieve your goals
  • Incredible self-confidence (you have zero doubt you‚Äôll hit quota)
  • Impeccable time management and attention to detail
  • Experience using a CRM like Hubspot or Salesforce
  • Experience managing outbound campaigns from list building, to outreach (call + email), CRM maintenance & consistent follow-up
  • Hungry to grow into full-cycle sales or leadership

As a fully remote team, we're looking for hands-on, experienced candidates who are able to focus on the work and get it done.



What You‚Äôll Do

Reporting to the CEO, you‚Äôll build upon our initial sales playbook to identify potential customers, develop outbound strategies, conduct outreach campaigns, and help convert prospects into customers.

You'll contact and qualify leads, then work closely with the CEO who will handle product demos and the sales process. Soon, you will be handing off to Account Executives, you have the potential to grow into that new role based on your performance in this one.

This team is in an exciting growth period as we focus on building out our sales organization from scratch, and this is our #1 hire right now. 

You‚Äôll be joining a small team and will help build out our team processes and culture and have a direct impact on the company‚Äôs maturity and success. So far, we've succeeded by putting the customer first, and we see each interaction as an opportunity to continuously improve the customer experience. 

We‚Äôre looking for more than just numbers on a board and someone that is excited by being part of the foundational team to accelerate growth and be rewarded accordingly.



What We Offer

The salary for this role is US $65k base with $90k OTE. 

We have a range of expanding and improving benefits and perks including:

  • Home office setup budget
  • Learning and development budget
  • 4 weeks paid leave

GrowYourBase (GYB) is a leading global metaverse developer across all major worlds and communities, starting with The Sandbox. The Sandbox is a user-generated gaming platform where creators can create assets and gaming experiences to monetize them on the Ethereum blockchain. Imagine Minecraft meets Roblox on the blockchain.

In order to achieve the goal of being the preeminent metaverse builder, GYB is building an industry-leading low-poly and voxel game development studio. GYB‚Äôs games and experiences are known for their innovative concepts, stunning visuals, and addictive gameplay. The cherry on top is the play-to-earn (P2E) mechanics that reward users with NFT‚Äôs and tokens for their engagement.

We‚Äôre on a mission to revolutionize the gaming industry. Join us in the revolution, one voxel at a time.

Job Description

As a Level Designer, you are responsible for designing and building the Sandbox gaming environment (using assets provided from our Voxel Artist team) so that it‚Äôs visually appealing, responds appropriately to user interactions, and fits the gameplay requirements. Success in this role requires a team player who enjoys the creative challenge of exploring the limits of the Sandbox Game Maker and can evolve with the constraints of the tooling environment.

To apply Please submit a cover letter, resume, and attach portfolio of your relevant work

Requirements: 2 years or equivalent education in Game Design Experience designing avatar-centric 3D levels (RPG or Adventure games) Attention to detail Knowledge about and proven experience with general level design concepts and game logic Gather competitive intelligence and research trends, insights, and best and leading practices in the industry Clear communication, organized, and autonomous Excellent written and spoken English Ability to manage deadlines and prioritize effectively Ability to learn in a fast environment and collaborate remotely via Discord, Zoom/Google Meet Familiar with Google Workspace suite of products, including Google Drive, Google Docs, Google Sheets

Nice to Have: Experience with project management software such as ClickUp, Jira, etc. Prior experience with The Sandbox Leadership experience Knowledge about cryptogames Experience with P2E gaming business models Knowledge about tokenomics and/or game incentive mechanisms

Location

San Francisco

The Gist

  • Bootcamp.com is the market leader in dental admission test prep, and we're rapidly expanding into medical education.
  • We‚Äôre a bootstrapped, profitable education company used by 20,000+ college / medical students a year to pass their classes and board exams.
  • We‚Äôre launching several new products in the next 12 months.
  • You‚Äôll have the opportunity to help design how our students prepare for the biggest tests of their lives.

About the Job

You‚Äôll be working closely with our co-founders and engineering team. We‚Äôll meet 1 - 2 times a week to discuss:
  1. High-level vision for Bootcamp.com design language
  2. The design challenge in focus for the week
Below are some design challenges that are would be typical of your work here:
  • Own large design initiatives end-to-end.
  • Work directly with our product and engineering team to build beautiful study experiences that revolutionize the way we learn online.
  • Create wireframes, high fidelity designs and prototypes to tackle difficult UX problems.
  • Maintain and iterate upon our Bootcamp.com brand visuals and design language.
  • Work simultaneously on some of the biggest problems (lower the friction to study so it's as simple as flipping open a book), as well as quick and dirty UI fixes
  • Design and update Bootcamp.com‚Äôs print and digital marketing materials, including flyers, powerpoints, and case studies.

About You

  • You have a solid understanding of Figma and know the ins-and-outs of auto layout, master components and variants, and can maintain an organized asset library.
  • You‚Äôve been on a remote team before and are comfortable working asynchronously.
  • Bonus if you‚Äôre familiar with Webflow, video editing, and / or have any experience with Javascript libraries like React.
We have a small team, so your impact will be felt immediately. Based on your performance, you may build a team of direct reports.

About Our Pay and Benefits

  • The salary range for this role is $90,000 - 130,000 (we use a compensation formula that adjusts for experience).
  • Equity in Bootcamp.com as well as a full benefit package including health, vision, dental insurance, 401k (US employees only at this time) and other perks.
  • Fully remote team but prefer you be located within 4 hours of EST
  • 3 weeks of paid time off

How to Apply

Send a link to your portfolio / personal website / relevant work samples, and anything else that will make you stand out, to michael.corrao@bootcamp.com. Please include PRODUCT DESIGNER in the subject of the email.

Hiring Process

If we‚Äôre interested, the hiring process follows these steps:
  1. We have an introductory call on Zoom.
  2. If we feel like it could be a good fit, we send you a 5-hour paid test project. You‚Äôll be paid the full amount regardless of whether we hire you or not.
  3. We talk again to review your test project and ideas.
  4. We agree on terms, pending references. I speak to a few of the people that you‚Äôve worked with.
  5. We start working together on a 30-day contract-to-hire basis to make sure we both feel set up for success.
We can‚Äôt wait to hear from you!

We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status.

results.role: Sr Software Engineer, Alerting and DDOS
results.text:
About Kentik

Kentik is the network observability company. Our platform is a must-have for the network front line, whether digital business, corporate IT, or service provider. Network professionals turn to the Kentik Network Observability Cloud to plan, run, and fix any network, relying on our infinite granularity, AI-driven insights, and insanely fast search. Kentik makes sense of network, cloud, host, and container flow, Internet routing, performance tests, and network metrics. We show network pros what they need to know about their network performance, health, and security to make their business-critical services shine. Networks power the world‚Äôs most valuable companies, and those companies trust Kentik. Market leaders like IBM, Box, and Zoom rely on Kentik for network observability. Visit us at kentik.com and follow us at @kentikinc.

The true meaning of Kentik is visibility. We are committed to making sure everyone feels empowered to use their voice, has a sense of belonging and is represented at Kentik. We don‚Äôt look for individuals who fit the culture, but those who will continue to add to the culture. We encourage everyone to apply, especially those individuals who are underrepresented in the industry: people of color, LGBTQI+ community, women, individuals with disabilities (both seen and unseen), veterans, people of any age or family status.

About the role

Kentik backend services ingest, enrich and store traffic metadata and metrics from the world's largest networks. They gather configuration and topology snapshots, actively monitor our customer's infrastructure and trigger automated actions in response to outages and attacks. Together, they form an internet-scale, highly available, distributed system that is the foundation to Kentik's ability to deliver complete end-to-end network observability to our customers.

Our custom streaming analytics pipeline aggregates and filters data on the fly, driving Kentik's rich alerting platform which alerts network engineers about outages, capacity issues, traffic shifts and protects networks with automated DDOS attack mitigations.

We are looking for experienced backend engineers wanting to apply their skills and experience taking Kentik to an industrial scale, specifically growing and scaling our real time, streaming systems to meet the needs of some of the most prominent companies on the internet.

We have built a team of world-class engineers, network experts, and influential technologists in a remote-first culture from day one. While prior experience in a remote environment is not required, we highly value strong collaboration and communication skills.

Working hours close to Europe are strongly preferred for this position (e.g., Europe, East Coast of the US, Brazil).

What to expect

  • Interacting closely with product managers and engineering managers to help define, plan and execute on project plans
  • Developing new features, performance improvements and bug fixes in a modern highly scalable SaaS platform
  • Participating in code reviews
  • Regularly collaborating with other engineering teams, as well as support and sales teams
  • Working on high-visibility, challenging engineering problems

You may be a good fit if you have

  • Passion for what you do and a willingness to grow and contribute to our team
  • Prior experience or strong interest for working on large scale SaaS systems 
  • 7+ years experience with Go, Python, Node or similar
  • A good understanding of SQL syntax, especially with PostgreSQL and MySQL
  • Good communication skills
  • Experience on any relevant areas to network observability (SNMP, Streaming Telemetry, BGP, general metrics collection, etc.)
  • Working hours close to Europe (located in Europe, East Coast of the US, Brazil, for example).

Our tech stack

  • Our core data engine and platform are primarily written in Go
  • We use Node.js + Express for application serving, and React as our primary UI framework
  • We also use some JS and Python for tooling/scripting
  • In addition to our own database, we use Postgres, Kafka, Mysql, and Redis
  • Haproxy, Envoy for API traffic routing and balancing
  • Github for source control, PRs, issues
  • Github actions and jenkins for automated builds

Healthcare and Leave*

  • Medical, Dental, and Vision that is 100% covered for employees & dependents
  • Health Reimbursement Account
  • Maternity/Paternity leave, medical leave to care for yourself or a loved one
  • Stock Options
  • Flexible time off
  • Vanguard 401(k) 
*Benefits are as listed for US employees. Local health insurance coverage and similar benefits vary for employees outside of the US.

Perks and Reimbursement Programs

  • $100 per month for wellness expenses and activities
  • Internet / Phone Reimbursement

Come work with us

We promise it will be worth it! You will be working at a fast-growing, well-funded startup, alongside world-class engineers and thought leaders as we build the future of network observability and digital operations. With a competitive salary and first-rate benefits on top of meaningful, challenging projects, we‚Äôre sure you will enjoy joining our team!

About the role As our senior performance marketing manager, you‚Äôll play a key role in building the biggest community of cycling and outdoor enthusiasts around the globe. You will manage the collaboration with our performance marketing agency executing our mobile ad campaigns on Google Ads, Apple Search Ads and Facebook. You‚Äôll take full ownership over all aspects of our performance marketing, including measurement, budget allocation and creative strategy. You will also test new channels to further accelerate the growth of komoot, and you can count on the full support of our design, copy and data teams every step of the way.

Ready for your next adventure?

What you will do - Take full responsibility for our performance marketing strategy to drive growth across various channels and in multiple markets around the world. - Lead and manage the collaboration with our performance marketing agency and their team of performance marketing managers, app store optimization experts, data analysts, designer and copywriters. - Ensure successful planning, execution and optimization of campaigns in different markets and on various ad platforms (Apple Search Ads, Google App Campaigns, Facebook Ads, Google Search Ads, etc.). - Test new ad networks and innovative formats to further accelerate the growth of komoot. - Monitor the performance of our apps in the app stores and oversee the app store optimization roadmap. - Maintain a good relationship with our app store representatives and ensure a high visibility through app store features. - Monitor our KPIs to ensure the budget is spent efficiently across all performance channels to maximize the impact of our performance marketing campaigns. - Ensure that we can measure the results of our campaigns and team up with our data analysts and client developers to implement event tracking and mobile measurement solutions following highest data protection standards. - Align our performance marketing campaigns with our global brand and marketing initiatives. - Ensure high quality and relevancy of our ad copy and creatives following our brand guidelines.

Why you will love it - Your work will have a direct impact on building the largest community of cyclists and outdoor enthusiasts in the world - You will be responsible for performance marketing campaigns on different channels and in 30+ countries with significant budgets from day one. - You can count on the support of a highly committed and skilled team, both in-house and at agency-side. - You‚Äôll have a self-determined job with personal responsibility to move things forward, shape the processes and choose the tools you need to do your best work. - You get 38 days annual leaves (including public holidays, which vary by country) - This is a remote role in a fully remote international team. You are free to work from anywhere that lies between the time zones UTC-1 and UTC+3. Will it be a beach? The mountains? Or a co- working space (covered by us)? - You‚Äôll travel with us (when safe) for team gatherings in amazing locations several times a year. You can check out this playlist to find out more about how we stay close while being remote. (http://bit.ly/39xtIrn )

You will be successful in this position if you have - 3+ years experience running paid campaigns for a mobile app with hands-on experience running Apple Search Ads, Google App Campaigns and mobile social ads as well as Google Search Ads. - Strong organizational skills to manage projects and campaigns with large amount of people from various backgrounds. - A structured and methodical way of running and optimizing performance marketing campaigns. - Proven experience of managing a performance marketing team or agency. - Strong analytical skills and the ability to transform data into actionable insights - A strong knowledge of mobile measurement and tracking solutions ( Adjust, Google Firebase, ‚Ä¶) . - A good understanding of attribution models, cohort analyses and ROI calculation. - Proven experience with app store optimization.

We support diversity and inclusivity within the outdoors and welcome all prospective applicants. - We have a rolling recruitment process. If this role is online it means it‚Äôs still open. We‚Äôre accepting applications and actively looking for the perfect candidate. Is it you?

Perks - 38 days of vacation (incl. public holidays) - Dedicated time and budget to spend on your professional development: classes, conferences, books ‚Äì you decide! - Discounts from leading outdoor and cycling brands - Flexible working hours and ability to work from anywhere in Europe - Three whole-company gatherings per year in beautiful locations - Optional ‚Äútogetherness‚Äù trips with your team - Costs covered for your co-working space membership or your work from home office - The latest devices and equipment to do your best work

$60,000 ‚Äî $110,000/year

About the role Cold calling, lead generation, account management. The word ‚Äúsales‚Äù and everything it entails is music to your ears! You love the feeling of closing the deal ‚Äì searching for new leads and helping them see the value in your product is all part of the fun! Komoot is growing with a speed of 1 million new users a month and with it our B2B ads inventory. Now we‚Äôre on the lookout for a senior sales & partnership manager to join Daniela, Max, and Iris ‚Äì our small but effective sales team ‚Äì on their mission to generate and acquire new B2B leads and scale our native ads sales.

Ready for your next adventure?

What you will do Sales lead generation and acquisition: - Drive lead generation and acquisition with full control over your sales activities to ensure our common sales and revenue goals are reached - Use traditional and digital channels or find new, creative ways to feed the sales funnel - Sell targeted Sponsored Collections ‚Äì komoot‚Äôs native ads ‚Äì to tourism destinations, transport companies, and other players in the outdoor industry - You look after our customers from the tourism sector in Germany, both in digitally supported day-to-day business and on site. - You are familiar with selling complex products with a long-term lifespan. - Ideally, you bring industry-specific relationship networks with you - Monitor the market and competition and keep an eye on relevant e-commerce KPIs through regular reporting - Work closely with the Brand/Editorial team to deliver tailor-made content to your partners

Account Management: - Manage a portfolio of B2B partners and support them with campaign planning and execution - Make your partners successful on komoot by onboarding them with our beloved academy - Drive performance-optimization efforts and ensure our B2B partners are getting the best value possible

Why you will love it - You‚Äôll work with a truly inspiring product that changes the way people explore the outdoors. - You‚Äôll team up with Daniela, Max & Iris - a dynamic trio constantly on the lookout for unique ways to reach their sales goals as a team. In their own words: ‚Äúnot your typical sales team.‚Äù - You‚Äôll have a self-determined job with personal responsibility to move things forward, shape the processes and choose the tools you need to do your best work. - You will become a part of a fully remote, diverse, and international komoot team. That is, 90 smart, inspiring and fun-loving humans with a wide range of backgrounds. - This is a fully remote role and you are free to work from any location that lies between the UTC-1 to UTC 3 timezone. Will it be on the beach? The mountains? Your house or a co-working space of your choice (covered by us)? Or maybe our HQ is situated by the lake in Potsdam, Germany? - You‚Äôll travel together with our team to amazing outdoor places several times a year to exchange ideas, learnings and go for hikes and rides. Check out these videos to find out more about us.

You will be successful in this position if - You have 5+ years of sales experience working with a community-oriented tech product. - You have the flexibility and skills to handle everything from small to very complex deals and account management and optimize our partner's success on komoot. - Cold calling is a breeze and sales is in your DNA. - You speak German and English on a native/business fluent level. - Words like CTR, CPC, bounce or interaction rates mean something to you. You have solid experience setting up and optimizing digital marketing campaigns. - You like working in a team - lone wolves won‚Äôt enjoy this environment. - Ideally, you are well connected in the tourism sector and have a strong network of contacts (e.g. from your current role, agency, etc.). - A driving license is required as you will attend some sales tours (when the situation is safe). - Bonus points: Digital tech sales experience; Fluency in French, Italian, Spanish or Dutch.

About the role Komoot is a tech company where data plays a decisive role. As our new marketing data analyst, your work will be invaluable in supporting a wide range of marketing initiatives with data insights. You‚Äôll work closely with brand experts, community managers, media managers, partnership managers, as well as developers and designers.

Ready for your next adventure?

What you will do - Create actionable insights for all types of marketing initiatives at komoot, from brand campaigns to performance marketing channels. - Measure the impact of newsletters, social media and influencer campaigns, print and online media advertising, and marketing partnerships. - Plan, run and evaluate qualitative surveys and market research, turning them into meaningful reports. - Design and analyse A/B tests for newsletters, landing pages and campaign creatives seen by millions of outdoor enthusiasts - Complement marketing experts with your data literacy skills, helping them make smarter decisions - Promote data-informed decision making in the marketing team - Craft ad hoc reports, comprehensible visualisations, dashboards and in-depth research reports.

GetYourGuide is looking for a talented Brand Copywriter to join our incredible in-house Creative Studio. As the voice of our brand in German, it‚Äôll be your job to excite and inspire our customers by driving our tone of voice across a variety of brand channels. You‚Äôll write engaging, on-brand copy on a daily basis across a range of formats, from out-of-home and print to digital and video. You‚Äôll transform our strategy into creative campaigns and ideas, and execute them from start to finish. You‚Äôll also be responsible for defining and driving brand copy standards across the company, and all the assets you create. The ideal candidate is a creative copywriter with a strong understanding of brand marketing goals and KPIs. You‚Äôll feel just as comfortable turning customers into brand advocates as you are at writing integrated campaigns from start to finish. Working closely with the Brand Copy Lead and English Copywriters, you‚Äôll push and develop our copy guidelines to create a tone of voice that gets our customers talking. We‚Äôre looking for a creative partner who collaborates closely with the designers, visual teams, and other stakeholders to consistently deliver exciting, innovative, and on-brand marketing assets. A desire to work in a fast-paced, dynamic environment is essential. Responsibilities:
  • Work closely with designers to interpret briefs, conceptualize them into idea directions, and execute them on deadline while taking into account budget and stakeholder satisfaction.
  • Create on-brand, on-brief copy to meet a range of brand goals and KPIs.
  • Drive copy excellence as the primary German writer on our brand awareness assets.
  • Develop and manage the German copy style across all marketing assets, working closely with user research and marketing teams to create clear and consistent messaging.
  • Use detailed research and data to understand customer needs and desires, tailoring your messaging to match accordingly.
  • Strategically translate market research and data into brand language and relevant stories.
  • Take responsibility for crafting engaging, structurally correct, and on-brief copy that influences various types of readers.
  • Develop and communicate our brand both externally and internally.
Requirements:
  • 4+ years of experience as a brand marketing writer.
  • A native German speaker with strong communication skills, both spoken and written.
  • Strong knowledge of German marketing work and cultural trends.
  • Fluent level of English. You‚Äôll be writing in German, but the studio‚Äôs day-to-day working language is English.
  • Excellent writing with a flair for short and mid-form brand marketing copy.
  • Eager collaborator and storyteller, with a strong interest in brand marketing.
  • Ability to develop unified marketing copy standards for GetYourGuide whilst understanding how they adapt on a channel-by-channel basis.
  • Ability to engage audiences with snappy and inspiring copy.
  • Very organized, driven, and not afraid to take ownership.
  • Proficient at managing multiple projects simultaneously.
We offer:
  • Annual learning budget
  • An open work environment where every voice is heard
  • International team with talented people from over 65 nations
  • GetYourGuide tour and activity vouchers to live the life of our customers by experiencing our products for yourself
  • Flexible, hybrid work environment

OVERVIEW

Fractured Atlas is seeking a full-time Senior Software Engineer (Ruby). Fractured Atlas is a national nonprofit art service organization with a membership of over 75,000. Our mission is to make the journey from inspiration to living practice more accessible and equitable for artists and creatives. We are dedicated to helping individual artists and arts organizations at every level of the cultural ecosystem, in every creative medium by providing fundraising tools, educational resources, and personalized support.


The successful candidate will be someone committed to writing clear, reliable, and maintainable code on a mission-driven, cross-functional team. We are seeking someone with significant full-stack experience with Ruby on Rails, who values Rails conventions and object-oriented design, with a track record of delivering features that require collaborating with product to resolve ambiguity and prioritize the highest impact work. The right candidate will be comfortable with a flat team structure and excited to collaboratively design and champion best practices to improve our applications and processes. Our lean, remote team collaborates across all departments to scope projects that ship quickly and have an immediate impact on the arts field. In addition to having high standards for the features we ship, our team has high expectations of respect and care for each other, making sure we maintain a healthy work life balance in Fractured Atlas‚Äôs ‚Äúwork hard, live well‚Äù environment. 


Our organizational culture embraces people who:

  • Are curious and excited by opportunities to better our services, our systems, and ourselves.
  • Seek out challenging problems and are comfortable with high-risk, high-impact efforts.
  • Are agile, creative problem solvers with a focus on concrete results.
  • Invest their time in quality work and giving others their respect and support.

At Fractured Atlas we adhere to strong anti-oppression and anti-racism principles in all areas of our internal and external work. This commitment is grounded in our belief that change is possible, and that our work and that of the artistic community as a whole will grow stronger as oppression is eliminated. Learn more about what it‚Äôs like to work at Fractured Atlas by visiting work.fractured atlas.org.


 


MAJOR DUTIES & RESPONSIBILITIES

  • Build and maintain Ruby on Rails applications that enable our thousands of fiscally sponsored projects across the US to crowdfund (over $25 million in donations processed annually), apply for grants, and receive support and oversight from Fractured Atlas staff.
  • Collaborate with colleagues across the organization to design and scope new features and enhancements.  
  • Guide the architecture and execution of technical solutions that prioritize impact while balancing scope, complexity, and other trade-offs.
  • Maintain and expand internal APIs and integrations with Stripe and other third-party software platforms.
  • Implement full-stack features, utilizing javascript and CSS as needed.

LOCATION

This position is U.S.-based and 100% virtual (with post-COVID travel about 1-2 times per year). You can live anywhere in the country but must be available to attend meetings during an 8:30 AM-5:30 PM EST window.

 


COMPENSATION

This is a full-time exempt position. Salary is $110,500.00 annually. Benefits include dental and medical insurance, flexible spending account, employer-contributed 401K plan, commuter benefits, professional development allowance, ticket and staff donation allowance for artist member projects, internet reimbursement, workplace supplies allowance, paid vacation and sick days, paid family leave, and a casual but hard-working, friendly and supportive work environment.

About Reflection.app:

Ten years ago brothers Mike and Dave Radparvar started Holstee, a company that provides inspiration and tools to help people lead more meaningful lives. After a decade of building physical products (like the Reflection Cards, Annual Reflection Journal, and Mindful Kits) they saw first hand how impactful journaling and reflection is for mental health, but also how difficult it is to build a lasting practice.

According to Dave, ‚ÄúIt‚Äôs difficult to know where to begin.‚Äù He describes how ‚Äúfor years, journaling has been my go-to tool for reflection. But even when I mastered the habit of writing about my days, there wasn‚Äôt an easy framework for looking back on past entries ‚Äî no guide to help find patterns in the things that brought me joy, or learn from the moments that challenged me.‚Äù

After years of researching, designing, and developing concepts with the Holstee team they arrived at Reflection.app ‚Äî the only digital journal that guides your growth each month.

Reflection.app is the only journaling app with a guided reflection framework built-in to help you look back on your entries with guided Monthly and Annual Personal Reviews ‚Äî helping bring clarity, perspective and gratitude to your life.

Today Reflection.app has native apps for iOS, Android, and Mac (in addition to a responsive Web app), over 20,000 users, 150,000+ entries created on the platform, and a 5-star app store rating. 

Reflection.app is supported by a diverse team based in the Netherlands, France, Spain, the United Kingdom, Colombia, the United States, and New Zealand. What unites us is our shared belief that self reflection helps us live more fulfilling and meaningful lives.

Hi!

We‚Äôre Mike and Robert, the founders of Reftab, a growing B2B SaaS startup helping Businesses, Schools and Maintenance Facilities track the equipment they own and operate. We closed a round of seed funding are looking for a talented individual to help us grow Reftab to the next level and beyond. 

We believe we have the absolute best asset tracking platform.  Our customers love the platform and the support they receive from us. Check out our reviews on Capterra to see what some of our customers are saying about us. 

This is a full-time position that is almost 100% remote. The vast majority of our meetings, as well as your meetings with customers and prospects will be online.

Why YOU Should Apply 

This is a unique opportunity to get in at the ground floor of a software startup company. We are profitable, growing rapidly, and we have secured funding to further accelerate our growth. That‚Äôs where you come in. It‚Äôs OK if you haven‚Äôt been in a position exactly like this before. In this position, you will learn what it takes to build a successful company and use that to grow in your role here, or start your own company in the future. 

You will be working directly with us, the founders/developers, so there is no red tape or layers of management to deal with. You will be able to influence and make real change, and see the results of those changes immediately. You will learn what it takes to build software that actually makes a huge difference in businesses and that people love to use every day. 

Responsibilities and Day-to-Day 

Your number one priority in this role will be to help grow the company by converting inbound leads into paying customers. You will engage with prospects who have signed up for a free trial or requested a product demo, and show them how to be successful with the software so they continue on as paid subscribers. 

While we do have a sales process and we will continue to evolve that process, we are not a hard sales organization. We know that we will provide the customer with exceptional return on their investment with us, and we just need to help them achieve that. The rest will take care of itself. 

You will perform product demos and walkthroughs, on-boarding calls, and train users to increase engagement with the various capabilities of the software.

As you will be spending a significant portion of your time speaking with existing and prospective customers, you will be learning all about the problems they are facing and what is important to them. We will work together on the product roadmap to prioritize new features and capabilities to be built into the system based on the direct feedback you are receiving. 

Despite our small team size, we build fast with new features and updates rolling out constantly, so it will be fun to watch the evolution of the app, and to delight customers with the kind of speed that makes them feel like this was built just for them. 

You will have a great opportunity to learn about and contribute to many different areas of the business. In addition to engaging with customers and influencing product development, you will take on various side projects as a secondary responsibility based on your strengths and interests.

Through these side projects you will have the opportunity to contribute to building out other systems and processes that will make your primary job easier, and ultimately help you be more successful in acquiring new customers. For example, you might: 

  • create new user guides and documentation, 

  • enhance or create drip email campaigns and email copy to improve user engagement and conversion, 

  • create video and written content for blogs and social media, 

  • and more. 
You don‚Äôt need to be an expert in marketing, but you will have the opportunity to learn and become an expert if you choose to. 

Requirements
 
In this role, you will need to take complete ownership over our incoming sales leads. You will be given all of the tools and support to be successful without being told what to do every step of the way. If this appeals to you, then this may be the perfect position for you. 

Here are some other qualifications that would make this role a good fit for you: 

  • You have at least 2 years of experience in a software customer success or sales role. 

  • You have a reliable and fast internet connection. 

  • You demonstrate friendliness and empathy when conversing with customers and other people, and can relate well to a variety of different people. 

  • You are comfortable proclaiming that you are tech savvy. You don‚Äôt need to be a developer, but you should be able to learn how to use new software products quickly and deeply. 

  • You love the idea of efficiency. You are constantly driving to make yourself more efficient, and the idea of making other people more efficient excites you. 

  • You are able to articulate how technology solutions can improve lives and improve business. 

  • You love to learn, and you love finding new ways to get things done better and faster.

  • You have excellent written and verbal communication. 

  • Experience in a SaaS company is a big plus, and experience or knowledge about IT departments is a huge plus.

How to Apply

Click the "Apply to this Position" button. Send us an email with your resume, (PDF preferably) and a few sentences introducing yourself.

  • Growing personally and professionally with one of the fastest growing companies

Virtuo is your car, on-demand. We‚Äôre bringing all the freedom of driving without the burdens of owning a car for you, our cities & the planet. Launched in 2016, our on-demand car rental app is releasing cities and their citizens from the burden of car ownership. Virtuo is freeing up space and time, putting the freedom of driving in people‚Äôs pockets, not parked on city streets. Our mission is to create a delightful on-demand car experience. Our vision is a future with no personal cars. Key Facts üì≤ +2,000,000 downloads ‚îÇ üë§ +100,000 users ‚îÇ üöô +4,500 cars ‚îÇ üí™ +130 Virtuoses üí∞ Fundraising in 2021: ‚Ç¨96M (Investors: AXA Venture Partners (AVP), Bpifrance Large Venture, Alpha Intelligence Capital, H14, Groupe BPCE, Natixis, Balderton Capital, Iris Capital and RAISE France). üèÜ Rewards: Best apps on the app store 2016&18, BPI France, and 2021 FrenchTech Top 120. üìç We are in France, U.K, Spain, and Italy (üá©üá™ soon ), service available in 54 locations We are VIRTUO üß† Virtuoso Mindset: We are talented, humble, and we always improve, experiment, and innovate. üí´ Impact is our OS: We focus on what drives the most significant impact for our customers, partners, and team. üí™üèº Responsible and proud: We are committed to our mission to free customers and cities from car ownership. üë• Togetherness: We help each other and grow stronger within and across teams. üíô Users are at the heart of everything we do. üôãüèº‚Äç‚ôÇÔ∏è Owners, not renters: We don\'t settle until we achieve our objectives. The opportunity Are you ready to add a key brick in the Berlin mobility ecosystem, and to build a city without cars? Are you keen to launch from scratch one of the most promising European mobility startups into a new market? Operations is at the core of Virtuo, our motto: \"Right car, right time, right location. Zero defects\". The team is responsible for making strategic & operational decisions, to develop and run our business on the ground. The Operations Executive role in Berlin offers the opportunity to implement a new mobility player in a new country, with a model that proved its potential in 4 countries already. Working alongside smart colleagues in a stimulating start-up environment also represents the opportunity to shape the future of European mobility. If you‚Äôre a natural-born leader who has always wanted to take part in the success of a start-up with global ambition, we would love to hear from you. üéØ Your missions:
  • Be the main person responsible for your region‚Äôs fleet (Berlin)
  • Run complex, on-the-ground, day-to-day operations; craft and improve processes
  • Optimize our fleet main KPIs: # of damaged cars, utilization rate, car delivery
  • Manage closely Virtuo stations: fleet allocation, be responsible for cleaning/convoys partners day to day management
  • Ensure our customer satisfaction is aligned with ambitious objectives by implementing demanding processes and monitoring them closely
  • And much more! (Expansion, Product improvement, ad-hoc projects, Admin, etc.)
‚ö° What's cool about this job:
  • Implement a business in a new city from scratch, but with a model that has been proven successful in already 20+ cities
  • Join a fast-growing start-up, a flagship of ‚Äúla French Tech 120 Startup‚Äù with incredible traction in Europe & be a part of an international team (over 4 countries)
  • Work for a startup where your decisions will have an immediate impact
  • Participate in building the Virtuo German team
  • Be a part of the whole Virtuo team, benefit from regular meet-ups with other countries, take advantage of their knowledge, while promoting your own market specifics
üåü You are the ideal candidate if:
  • 1+ years of experience a start-up/scale-up or in consulting
  • Start-up mindset: tenacious, and a hands-on
  • Highly organized ‚Äì you are very analytical, rigorous, effective at managing deadlines, with strong attention to detail
  • Analytical, confident with numbers, and experienced in excel
  • Accountable, willing to take initiative, and to learn fast
  • Obsessed with the customer experience and inspired by mobility
  • Fluent in German & English, French is a plus
üîç Recruitment process: 1. Discovery interview with our people team 2. Interview with our Lead Expansion Manager 3. Interview with our COO 4. Technical test interview 5. Interview with our Country Manager and culture fit üéÅ Perks: üí™üèº A competitive equity package üöó Virtuo‚Äôs special discount code üè° Flexible remote work policy ü™ë Your whole work equipment provided with Fleex ü™ú Career path development and training and programs üé° Seminar, team building, and team events throughout the year
