The opportunity Be the marketer who launched Virtuo in Germany! You will work closely with the CMO and the Head of brand & local marketing in our Paris HQ as well as the local Country Manager in Germany. You will craft and execute the marketing strategy for Virtuo in Germany from the very beginning. You‚Äôll be a key component to the team and will fully own Virtuo‚Äôs marketing efforts locally. You will collaborate with the other marketing team members with central roles in order to ensure the best strategies and execution for Germany. We are looking for highly motivated and self-driven individuals, with a clear passion for marketing and communication to help in the amazing growth of Virtuo and its introduction into the German market. üéØ Your missions: As Marketing Manager for Germany you will: Launch Virtuo into a new country
  • Launch Virtuo to German Consumers. You will develop strong point of views on how we win consumers in the market and lead execution together with HQ team.
  • Getting results: Making your ideas work and driving concrete, visible results on customer acquisition, week on week, as well as on the awareness and vibrancy of the Virtuo brand, in line with the company vision & mission.
  • Mine and share local insights to ensure highly effective marketing communications
Drive our awareness locally
  • You will design and execute Virtuo‚Äôs visibility and local acquisition strategies, including defining relevant audiences and levers to conquer them, including social, partnerships, stunt, or any other local activation you will come up with.
  • Find opportunities to raise our profile via PR and media activations.
  • Coordinate product and city launches as we grow our presence.
  • Be in charge of the community management and social media presence, connecting with key audiences.
  • Build partnerships including with influencers to drive awareness and new customer acquisition.
Be the face and voice of Virtuo
  • Provide insights to central marketing team members so all efforts are aligned and consistent to win in the market - customer attitudes, competition, but also Virtuo‚Äôs performance on the market and in the numbers.
  • Create great content, crafting fresh and impactful messages that attract people in and make them relate with what we stand for, input adaptation of cross-markets content so it resonates for your German audiences.
  • Be the face of Virtuo at events and represent our brand.
‚ö° What's cool about this job:
  • Opportunity to own the marketing strategy for your market, define and test ideas and see clear output from your efforts.
  • Work in a multi-skilled, multi-cultural team that will give you a deep understanding of marketing as well as operations, customer insight & more.
  • Take on a pivotal role to the future of Virtuo that will challenge you every day.
  • Leave your mark on the business by proposing new ways of working, creating processes, and testing new ideas.
üåü You are the ideal candidate if: Have a start-up mindset
  • At least 5 years of marketing experience as a generalist and/or focused on operational marketing, in-house or in an agency.
  • Self-starter, autonomous, organized, both a planner and showing agility.
  • Hands-on, eager to make things happen, with a bias for action.
Impact driven
  • A startup attitude: a visionary mindset and a problem solver at heart You're Left brain / Right brain
  • Strong communicator, internally and externally, to customers, partners, press etc. Extraordinary social skills at all levels. Strong at collaboration with other teams.
  • A great understanding of social media
  • Strong creative writing skills
  • Analytical, proficient at Excel
  • Driven by customer & local insight
Empathetic team player
  • Passionate about our customers‚Äô happiness, Virtuo‚Äôs experience, and the role Virtuo can play in the mobility landscape.
  • A strong team player, within the marketing team but also locally with other teams, especially Operations.

Getsafe is one of the fastest growing tech companies in Europe. Through our app, we offer digital insurance and protect people and everything that is important to them, so that they can live freely and self-determined - regardless of who they are and how they live. Our team has over 150 colleagues from more than 30 nations. To help us continue our growth, we are looking for talents who think entrepreneurially and share our values: we grow together, can rely on each other and turn opportunities into successes. With $115 million raised to date and serving over 250,000 customers, we are one of Europe's top funded insurtechs. We have offices in Berlin, Heidelberg and London. Your role and the impact you'll have: Getsafe is working on building the radically best insurance for first-time insurance buyers through technology and a great customer experience. We have 250k (and growing) happy customers using our app and services. We‚Äôre looking for a Senior Frontend Developer to join our growing engineering team to work on cutting edge infrastructure and APIs that need to be highly performant and deal with the complex domain of insurance problems.
  • You will work in a cross functional team together with product and data to conceptualize and develop new features for our product and platform.
  • Work smarter, not harder. Build solutions that enable us to move faster as we scale and not build 1-offs.
  • Iterate quickly towards the best solutions for our customers and business.
  • Write high quality code and improve our overall technical system and architecture to scale with our growing portfolio of insurance products and countries that we‚Äôre available in.
  • Take ownership and be a leader in the team of best practices and push our technology forward along with supporting more junior members of the team.
Technologies you'll work with:
  • JavaScript
  • TypeScript and Flow
  • React, React Native, Redux and Styled Components
  • Next.js and Sanity.io
  • Heroku
  • REST APIs powered by Ruby on Rails (you won‚Äôt work on them, but will interact with them)
About you:
  • 4+ years experience in frontend development working on complex systems
  • Experience writing robust, scalable, maintainable HTTP and RESTful APIs.
  • Experience with relational databases
  • Responsibility for high-quality and reliable code along with knowledge of how to test it
  • You have the ability to distill a complex problem into its essential elements, and clearly communicate your vision to the team.
You can look forward:
  • A fast and value-oriented company with flat hierarchies and helpful colleagues
  • A positive, focused, appreciative, and goal-oriented atmosphere. Our working environment is our heart and soul
  • Getsafe is shaped by each and every one of us. We are a close-knit team and host after work events
  • A competitive remuneration package with trust-based working hours as well as sustainable career and development opportunities. We invest in your growth!
  • Support for relocation, work permits, and other administrative procedures as well as free German classes, if needed
  • Modern and spacious rooms kitted out with the best equipment offer you all the possibilities to work freely. We have comfortable couches & community areas ‚Äì what do you feel like doing today?
Perks & Benefits:
  • Environment based on trust - Flex working hours and location (home office option)
  • Modern centric offices in Heidelberg, Berlin and London
  • Yearly individual development budget
  • Employee Participation Program in the form of VSOPs
  • Your choice of hardware
  • 28 days of vacation
  • Getsafe insurance voucher for the policy of your choice

results.role: (Senior) Account Executive DACH (f/m/d) – Berlin/Remote // GraphCMS GmbH
results.text:
GraphCMS is looking for an (Senior) Account Executive (DACH) who will drive our growth by acquiring new enterprise-grade customers in German-speaking countries. In this quota-carrying role, you will lead and consult prospects throughout the end-to-end sales process - from qualifying to closing. The DACH market is already established and of primary importance to GraphCMS. There is a solid inbound pipeline you can rely on - GraphCMS already powers the applications of global brands like like Dr. Oetker, Gamescom, ADAC, and Shure. This role could rapidly evolve into a leadership role managing our DACH team. The team of GraphCMS is committed to building the most advanced content management system on the market. GraphCMS is trusted by an enthusiastic community of over 50,000 engineering teams delivering millions of digital experiences worldwide. What you will be working on
  • Converting your own enterprise-grade prospects ‚Äì mostly inbound ‚Äì into customers.
  • Delivering customised product demos targeted to our engineering and product audience ‚Äì with the support of our Solution Architects.
  • Preparing proposals and negotiating commercial terms with decision-makers.
  • Improving our sales process and strategy ‚Äì with the rest of the Account Executives and the Head of Sales.
What we expect from you.
  • 2-4 years of experience in selling digital products.
  • Confident in demonstrating our products via presentations and webinars.
  • Natural understanding of the sales process.
  • Excellent communication skills in German and English (written and spoken).
  • Experience with SaaS business models and startups is a plus.
Working at GraphCMS
  • We have a low-ego environment where all our team members are empathetic, always understanding and ready to support each other.
  • You get the chance to join early and be part of shaping the future of our company.
  • Extensive onboarding which will empower you with the sales, customer, product and technical knowledge. You will have multiple sessions with the Head of Sales and other team members to get to speed with your role.
  • Our team members are passionate about our product and self-motivation is the driving factor for our teams' success.
  • We believe in a remote-first approach where everyone is encouraged to do their best from wherever they are, and work together with individual responsibility and accountability. A flexible work environment encourages people to work according to what works best for them and maintain a good work-life balance.
  • We are an international and friendly team spread across 10 countries, coming together once a year for our annual off-site/retreat.
  • We provide a competitive compensation package, latest IT equipment, 30 days of annual vacation, and a personal growth & education package.
The Process Please expect the following steps for this role after you apply. The response time is usually within 1 week for each step. You could expect some alterations when necessary.
  • Intro call with People Manager
  • Interview with Hiring Manager(s)/Case study if applicable
  • Team-fit conversation
  • Offer
GraphCMS is an equal opportunity employer and committed to hiring people with diverse backgrounds. We believe that diversity, unique backgrounds, qualities, and different cultures enriches the productivity at our work space and also promotes innovation and creativity.

About the role Apheris is pioneering a new way to securely share data across companies. We're looking for a hands-on and thoughtful tech lead to help us level up our distributed infrastructure, data science tooling and integration capabilities with Big Data processing tools. You will lead one of our cross-functional teams, (comprised of engineers and data scientists) at a pivotal time in our growth and directly report to our Founder and CTO Michael. You will play a key role in owning our product delivery and partnering with another tech lead to evolve our long-term technical strategy and grow and develop the team towards highest operational efficiency. You will work closely with other specialists across the organization, so excellent communication skills and a collaborative mentality are crucial. We‚Äôre seeking candidates with experience of high-growth, fast-paced environments and who have a track record of leading best-in-class teams that develop technical data products. Though you‚Äôll build and manage a team, this role is hands-on and requires excellent technical leadership abilities. You should be a problem solver and execute on opportunities quickly. You will be leading a team of very experienced, motivated, and highly intelligent engineers and data scientists, so you should have a deep understanding of data products and Cloud architecture. The product: The Apheris Platform is an end-to-end platform for Data Scientists and AI engineers to collaboratively analyze distributed data in a privacy-preserving way. We are developing an entirely new discipline: data science on data you cannot see. Our high-profile enterprise customers have the highest requirements for security and IP protection, and we apply our technology and services to some of the world‚Äôs most impactful use cases that have very sensitive and valuable data. In the role of Tech Lead, you will genuinely impact the way the world securely shares and interacts with data. About the company: Apheris is growing at an astounding pace! With our best-in-class team of engineers, we have built a unique product offering and we're experiencing strong early traction from our high-profile enterprise customers. So far, we have achieved an incredible amount of success with our small team; we now need to grow our team in order to deliver a great user experience at scale. The category Secure Multi-Partner Data Collaboration is just starting to take off, and we want to build the foundations for scale to meet this opportunity in different industries and geographies, all the while delivering a product that our early customers love and realize real business value from. We offer our employees and team members a chance to work in one of the most rewarding environments. Our mission is to securely connect data across organizations to collaboratively solve the planet‚Äôs largest problems. Already today, we apply our technology to highly impactful projects that can range from solutions to tackle global diseases with the highest unmet clinical needs to lowering carbon emissions across industrial supply chains. We are an impact-driven company, and we are searching for people who want to scale this impact together with us. What you will do
  • Lead a high-performing, cross-functional team of engineers including backend, frontend, DevOps/cloud, QA, and data engineering, as well as data scientists.
  • Be a hands-on engineering contributor ‚Äì in addition to managing the team, write your own code, review code of your team members, coach them on coding best practices etc.
  • Help define the design and architecture of major software components, systems, and features. Derive technical requirements and help manage technical debt in a high-growth environment.
  • Manage the team‚Äôs backlog and advocate for technical initiatives in line with our technical roadmap. Manage team deliverables through agile methodologies and propose enhancements to improve workflows and elevate efficiency and delivery excellence.
  • Take a leadership role in multiple simultaneous high-impact projects, including facilitating design discussions, breaking down plans into work items, and mentor team member.
  • Provide a consistent and successful interface between engineering and product management. Communicate clearly in verbal and written forms, from peer training to design documents.
  • Architect, build, and maintain tools for a self-service infrastructure that improves developer efficiency and code reliability.
  • Work with a team dedicated to improving the business every day. Jump in and mediate bottlenecks hands-on ‚Äì including leading decision-making about technical architecture, implementing software solutions, code reviews, etc.
You should apply if
  • A demonstrated track-record of managing best-in-class cross-functional teams (comprised of engineers, ideally with embedded data scientists), including direct experience with performance management and development practices.
  • Multiple years of hands-on development experience ‚Äì you are a software engineer and can lead technical discussions on every level across stakeholders, and still write your own code.
  • Demonstrated experience collaborating with product and engineering leadership to translate product objectives to delivery and ensure priorities and expectations are both aligned and are realistic.
  • A strong grasp of programming‚Äôs best-practices (e.g., code clarity, documentation, git workflows) and experience with cloud infrastructure and cloud-native application development, including Docker containers, preferably on AWS.
  • A passion for relentlessly striving to push toward best practices and team goals while being flexible in a fast-paced startup environment.
  • Expert coding skills in multiple programming languages, especially Python (we use Python for most of our product and Javascript (Vue) for Frontend) and previous hands-on experience with AWS or other cloud platforms (e.g., GCP, Azure) and development of internal, and external APIs.
  • Great leadership skills with demonstrated experience of taking on a lead role in a team of engineers and data scientists, preferably in an agile Scrum setting. You should be able to confidently take ownership of a problem, gather ideas to solve it, and convey your approach efficiently.
  • Based in a European time zone.
Bonus points if
  • You have experience in developing enterprise-grade software for large B2B data products and a solid understanding of infrastructure security (https, SSH, 2FA, etc.) and modern networking for private cloud and public Internet services
  • You have expert skills with AWS services and cloud-native application development on AWS ‚Äì including AWS services such as EC2, VPC, Step Functions, CloudWatch, CloudTrail, container services, such as ECR, ECS, EKS, as well as infrastructure as code via Terraform, CloudFormation and CDK.
  • You have experience with Python data analysis frameworks (e.g., Pandas, Numpy) and machine learning frameworks (e.g., PyTorch, Tensorflow, scikit-learn).
  • You have experience building distributed or federated systems.
  • You are based in Berlin or Germany.
If you don‚Äôt match 100% of the requirements but think you're a good fit for the role, we encourage you to apply anyway. We care about finding people with the right values, motivation and potential to grow, and will work with you to adapt the role if it‚Äôs the right fit. What we offer you
  • High degree of empowerment from our Founders
  • Impact; you build up your own team, and you contribute to developing an entirely new discipline that will change how value is unlocked from data
  • Autonomy; we want to hire you because of your expertise and knowledge, and we‚Äôll give you the space to do your best work

About Apheris We are Apheris, a deep tech company at the forefront of the AI revolution that is on a mission to fundamentally reinvent how organizations collaborate and extract value from data. The Apheris Platform sets out to empower organizations to securely analyze distributed data of multiple parties, while keeping proprietary information private. Our company is a community of interdisciplinary and industry-leading researchers and engineers. We are backed by top investors and tech industry innovators, including LocalGlobe, MuleSoft founder Ross Mason and Twitter board chairman Patrick Pichette (former CFO of Google) and we work closely with Fortune 500 customers to develop our globally leading enterprise Apheris Platform for federated and privacy preserving data science. We are experiencing rapid growth and are recruiting for ambitious and adventurous team members to help us build a better future for data. Logistics

results.text:
About us At Skoove, we unlock the magic of playing an instrument. With more than 1,5 million users today, we create an interactive app to learn piano. With our team of more than 30 certified music nuts, we combine music learning science, audio technology, and machine learning to build a unique company in the music tech space. Your Mission As an App Marketing Manager, you work directly with our Marketing Director and in close collaboration with our Performance Marketing Manager, designers and copywriters. You use your skills in App Marketing to bring our app to the next level in different platforms (Google Play, App Store) and channels (Organic and Paid). Ready to join our band? Apply now! Your Job
  • You identify opportunities and define strategies to grow our app organically on both App Store and Google Play Store through ASO
  • You take care of all App Store Optimization (ASO) efforts including keywords, screenshots, preview video, reviews and everything else that impacts the app store presence
  • You drive initiatives and test and report on hypotheses that improve App Store ranking, organic installs and app conversion rate and test and report on hypotheses
  • You own the conception, implementation and monitoring of advertising campaigns on mobile app marketing channels with focus on Google Play Ads and Apple Search Ads and ensuring positive return on investment (ROI) and return on ad spends (ROAS).
  • You plan and manage the ad budget
  • You own the asset creation process, from coming up with specs to briefing designers and copywriters
  • You present regular updates on core metrics: downloads, active users, CPAs, ratings in various internal meetings
  • You are continuously monitoring market, competitors and trends and get insights to stay up-to-date and ahead of the curve
Your Profile
  • You have 3+ years of proven experience in App Marketing for iOS and Android as well as paid acquisition
  • You have an excellent understanding of ASO best practices, as well as knowledge of app store algorithms, optimization methods and effective strategies for growing app installs in multiple countries
  • Experience in Facebook and Google Ads and other ad networks is a plus
  • You have an analytical mindset and are able to spot patterns and trends
  • You are a creative thinker that can communicate and guide designers and copywriters as well as developers
  • You have good skills in Project Management
  • Very good English language skills, other languages a plus
  • Ideally Berlin (Germany) based or willing to relocate to Berlin
What's in it for you?
  • Attractive salary
  • Highly qualified core team with opportunity for personal and professional development
  • Lean hierarchies and short decision making processes
  • Diverse and friendly international team
  • Fresh fruits, good coffee and suntan-friendly-south-facing terrace
  • Fast, sustainable growth and daily new challenges
  • Creative working space in trendy Berlin, Friedrichshain and flexible remote policy
  • If you have to move to Berlin, we will support you while settling in
Eligibilty
  • You're holder of a German/European working permit

Software Engineer Android f/m/d

Our mission is to create a delightful on-demand car experience.
Our vision is a future with no personal cars.

About Abine / DeleteMe

Abine is a leading online privacy company. Backed by General Catalyst VC and Atlas VC, it was founded in 2010 and is a growing + profitable SaaS privacy business with multiple subscription privacy tools for consumers and corporations. For more info on our products, please check out Blur and DeleteMe for yourself. Growth in online privacy is being driven by consumers tired of their data being used without their consent for political ads, doxxing, and ID theft. Advertising by major brands like Apple‚Äôs privacy campaign help spread awareness. Finally, new global regulations like GDPR, LGPD, and CCPA are giving consumers new privacy protections and forcing businesses to think proactively about data privacy.



About The Role

Abine / DeleteMe is looking for a Data Engineer to help us manage and use data to make good decisions about what we build, how we help our customers, and how we grow our company. You will work closely with our engineering and product teams to improve the way we collect, structure, and store data, and with our management, marketing, sales, and service teams to understand what they need to know about the business and get them the data they need to help them make good decisions.

What You'll Do
  • Analyze the data we have and the data we create to better understand its value
  • Improve our data collection and storage practices to enhance the value of our internal data
  • Build pipelines and data flows to ensure our data is available where it is needed when it is needed
  • Talk to everyone in our business who needs to make good decisions with our data, and design systems that will get them the data that will help them do so
  • Design and implement a strategy and systems for data reporting, querying, and visualization to enable everyone in the business to explore our data, answer their questions, and make good decisions


Qualifications

You don‚Äôt need a specific background for this role. We‚Äôre looking for someone with strong technical and people skills, with some experience in data engineering, who wants to be a big part of helping a team achieve big things, who believes in privacy as a mission, and can both operate independently and help a team be more than the sum of its parts.

  • Experience with SQL
  • Experience with database design and implementation
  • Experience with appropriate programming languages and technologies
  • Experience with data reporting and visualization tools
  • Excellent written and verbal communication skills
  • A Bachelor's or more advanced degree is great, but not required
  • A Computer Science or other STEM degree is great, but not required
Benefits:

  • Medical, Dental, Vision, FSA, HSA, Commuter, Life and Disability Benefits
  • Flexible work hours
  • Great compensation package (salary, equity)
  • Meeting-light culture


Hiring Process:

The Abine hiring process typically takes 30-60 days from the initial job posting to complete. Our process is designed to get to know you as a person and professional. It is also designed to get a feel for how you might perform in the targeted role along with helping you to get a sense of what it might be like to work with our team. Please note that we may also consider you for other current and future positions we may be hiring for or have available. We aim to communicate where you stand in our hiring process upon the completion of each of our steps.

The Opportunity

Modern Tribe is looking for a talented, detail oriented Product Strategist to join our team. The Product Strategist‚Äôs primary role is to work with our clients to help focus business objectives, develop and interpret project goals, and translate them into executable plans for our teams.

This requires a broad understanding of business strategy, software/website development, user experience, technology, how it can be used to accomplish objectives, and how that technology will intersect with individuals inside and outside of an organization. The Product Strategist is one of our primary intersections with our clients - you are one of the faces of our projects.

The Product Strategist supports design and dev teams by providing research, goals and requirements to inform creative ideation on features and presentation of content and technical scope. This role requires an understanding of the product development cycle, how to release and when to release, how to target an MVP and guide a product roadmap successfully.


Inclusion Statement

Modern Tribe is committed to a culture that embraces diversity and inclusion. We foster an environment of collaboration, open engagement, fairness and respect regardless of differences in age, race, disability, national origin, gender identity, religion, sexual orientation or veteran status. As a hybrid workspace ranging from distributed contractors to traditional employees, we value the unique perspectives and experiences of our global team.

We come from all walks of life. We are small business owners. We are tattoo aficionados and 80‚Äôs movie buffs and ex-pats. We are homeschool teachers. We are single parents. We are musicians, college drop-outs, and entrepreneurs. We are travelers, feminists, runners, volunteers, and makers. We are a Modern Tribe.

Everyday we strive to fulfill our motto: live well and do good work. We hope you will consider joining us.


What You‚Äôll Do

Guide the discovery and research of multiple projects


  • Perform user and stakeholder research
  • Speak directly with stakeholders and users about their needs and pain points
  • Facilitate team sprint planning by walking them through ideas and requirements
  • Be a creative collaborator with your Project Manager as well as Creative and Engineering during discovery and ideation
Guide and shape project execution:

  • Inform creative briefs and technical scope by providing goals, requirements, constraints and artifacts
  • Identify, document and translate requirements into executable plans that adhere to both timeline and budget.
  • Work with team members to estimate features.
  • Review and sign off on features, sprint demos, and prototypes.

Own the customer relationship, along with your project leads, steering the client through the project lifecycle and setting expectations.

  • Provide customer relationship leadership, management, customer advocacy and upselling
Personal Competencies

  • Strong communication skills
  • Experience working as part of a remote team
  • Self-motivated, detail-oriented
  • Strong organizational skills
  • A methodical approach to all tasks
  • Ability to prioritize workloads and meet deadlines
  • Ability to work on multiple projects at the same time and complete tasks in a timely manner
  • Ability to work remotely with little-to-no supervision is a must
  • Excited to be part of a team with the potential for a long term relationship
  • Fluent English speaker

Knowledge & Experience

  • 3-5 years of experience working as a Product Strategist ideally on a distributed web design / dev team
  • Experience performing user and stakeholder research
  • Experience Identifying, documenting and translating requirements into executable plans that adhere to both timeline and budget.
  • Experience owning the customer relationship through the project lifecycle and setting expectations.
  • Deep WordPress experience



Bonus Points


Deeper experience in

  • Experience in interpreting analytics
  • UX & IA Skills - wireframing tools, site mapping tools
  • UX strategy processes i.e. affinity mapping, user research, user journey mapping, etc.

Location

Work from anywhere in North, Central or South America. If your timezone is outside of US business hours but you work at least 4+ hours of overlap each day, let's chat. You must be fluent in English. You just need a computer and a strong wifi signal to support daily video chats with the Tribe.


Compensation

This is a freelance contract about 20-25 hours per week. Pay range is USD $50-70 per hour commensurate with background, qualifications and experience. We often start our freelancers on a one time contract position (though we are always seeking long standing relationships with awesome people).


Perks

We believe that distributed working is a way of life. We understand what it means to work remotely. We offer consistency in expectations, payment, and support. We believe in learning from each other and fostering personal growth. You can expect to learn a lot while working with us.

(Also, if you work enough with us, we‚Äôll bring you on the team trips.)


Who We Are

Modern Tribe, Inc. is a rapidly growing software & design company. We develop custom solutions for some of the world‚Äôs largest companies, government institutions and smaller growing organizations. We pride ourselves on our ability to bridge people and technology and to bring the passion and dedication of an entrepreneur to every project. Our team is composed of talented employees and freelancers around North & South America (and a smattering across the globe).


Who You Are

We love working with each other because we have built a culture that suits us well. We work primarily with freelancers and coordinate their talents for large projects. To be on our team, you must be:

  • HAPPY: Where there is a will, there is a way. Having a positive disposition allows us to achieve great things and to support each other.
  • HELPFUL: Always looking for ways that you can help others.
  • CURIOUS: It is essential that you have a passion for learning. Technology changes daily, and life has a way of constantly raising the bar.
  • ACCOUNTABLE: Our clients expect us to get the right thing done on budget and on time. Communicating expectations and meeting them is the cornerstone of success.

More About You

  • You work autonomously. You are comfortable solving problems as they arise. You try new things and hold yourself accountable for the work that you do.
  • Your team can depend on you. You love process and you retain the details, big and small, of a project. You manage multiple projects at a time and are able to prioritize between them.
  • You have excellent analytical skills.
  • You don‚Äôt know all the answers, but you are great at leveraging your creative and engineering team to answer them. You know when you need support from Agency Leadership. You enjoy working with peers to discuss challenges and share knowledge

UserWise is building a sophisticated game operations platform for the world's top mobile gaming companies. We are bold adventurers looking to revolutionize the gaming industry by making it faster and easier for game studios to engage with their players.

What is our culture and team like?

We're a team of talented individuals who love our craft and do our jobs well. We believe we are the best in our fields and want other A+ players to come join us. We are all adults and take responsibility for our roles while encouraging and supporting those around us. We will build you up and equip you to be your best self possible. We wont drag you down. We wont get in your way. We wont force you to work in a way that makes you unproductive. 

We believe in the speed of trust. You should be able to ask anyone at UserWise to do something and have complete trust that they will get it done for you. No need to badger or check in. We're all here to support each other. And we expect the same out of you.

Everyone at UserWise is about our core values. We're all:
  • Creative
  • Accountable
  • Masterful 
  • User Focused

We are collectively on a mission to engage and entertain the world. üåé

We are constantly dreaming, testing and optimizing. We believe in open communication, transparency, support, pride and happiness in the work we do each day.

We work exceptionally hard but we also believe in work life balance - there's far more to this life than work.

While we constantly blow away people by how much we accomplish in so little time, we all take significant time off to enjoy life (and you should too). Time off allows us to foster the creative juices that help us solve the previously unsolvable. We're able to accomplish so much because we have the most talented people that can just get more done far faster.

Who are we looking for?

We are looking for world-class, full-stack developers to build the UserWise platform.  We are looking for developers who rise amongst the rest. Bold adventurers who want to change the mobile gaming industry with us.

We want you to:
  • Have a genuine passion for coding and get excited about learning new languages and platforms
  • Have an ability to troubleshoot and solve challenges independently and with a team
  • Be excited about developing a platform supporting hundreds of game devs, reaching millions of gamers
  • While you may have an area of concentration, you understand everything about the front and back end
Bonus points if you love to play games. And extra points if you've built games.

Qualifications and Skills:
  • 5+ years of experience in a professional work setting (we're open to waiving time requirements if you blow us away on your programming tests)
  • 3+ years of software development experience
  • Programming experience with front and back end; bonus if you have experience creating toolsets
  • Experience with a web framework like Ruby on Rails or Django
  • Experience with front end languages including JavaScript, HTML5, CSS, Webpacker, and Angular or React.
  • Experience working with MongoDB, postgres, redis, memcached, elastic search, and key-value database technology
  • You have experience working on a SaaS platform
  • You have experience working with server side code, API‚Äôs, and databases
  • Experience with test driven development

Our Tech Stack:
  • Ruby on Rails
  • Angular 8+
  • MongoDB
  • PostgreSQL
  • AWS
  • Android / iOS / Unity SDKs

Benefits and Perks:

  • Self improvement - Annual funds towards self-development such as books, courses, and industry conferences and events - including GDC. Our policy is that you should always be learning. What you're learning we don't really care - we cover the costs of pretty much anything you want to learn because you never know how that could positively impact the company. 

  • 100% Paid benefits - We pay 100% of the insurance coverage so you and your loved ones can stay healthy.

  • 401k Match - We match 100% of the first 4% you contribute.

  • Work from anywhere - Work from a home office or a coworking space that‚Äôs convenient for you.

  • Unlimited vacation - A supportive team that actively encourages you to take time off and recharge. Our official policy is to be an adult. Take the time you need but don't leave your team in a tough spot. Our leadership team tries to set the tone by taking 7+ weeks/year off, but everyone sets their own schedule. As long as you get your work done we really don't care.

  • Equipment budget - New hires receive a home office budget and company provided equipment needed to do your job well.

  • Parental leave - For all parents, you can take time off as you‚Äôre welcoming a new member of the family.

  • Work with game studios - The gaming space is one of the most exciting and fastest growing industries to work in. Work with studios large and small in all manner of genres. Your research will include things like playing WoW, Candy Crush and Mario. Yes, we get paid to play games.

UserWise is an equal opportunity employer. UserWise does not discriminate on the basis of sex, race, ethnicity, color, age, sexual orientation, gender (including identity and expression), disability (mental or physical), religion, national origin, citizenship, marital status, military or veteran status, or any other protected classification protected by applicable law; we will provide reasonable accommodations for qualified individuals with disabilities, and pursuant to applicable fair chance ordinances, we will consider for employment qualified applicants with arrest and conviction records.

Role

Lead the development and execution of the organization's marketing and advertising initiatives. Foresee our marketing needs in the future at a high level and also implement, lead, be creative, and project manage. Oversee lead generation, lead nurture, conversion, and upsell. 

Responsibilities
  • Lead the marketing department team and strategies, which includes our social media team, marketing manager, project manager, content marketing / SEO team, ad agency, podcast agency, etc.
  • Responsible for growing the marketing department team.
  • Plan, execute and oversee the implementation of a marketing strategy for new and existing products, services, and events.
  • Strategize with the VP of Innovation and Growth and our CEO.
  • Own our website, landing pages, funnels, and optimize them regularly. 
  • Manage and measure marketing campaign costs and ROI and make adjustments.
  • Report on the effectiveness of marketing campaigns using predetermined KPIs.
  • Stay updated on new marketing methodologies and promote internal conversations about changes that need to be made, tracking methods, shifts in marketing trends, etc.
  • Provide strategic input/feedback on product projects that help our customers market better.
  • Manage the volume and quality of content we publish.

Requirements
  • 5+ years of experience in Marketing (preferably SaaS)
  • Excellent verbal and written communication skills.
  • You are assertive, with excellent project management skills. You have the ability to set goals and develop achievable timelines to hit them.
  • You have excellent research skills to analyze our current process, understand our products and our customers, and create marketing campaigns that are based on numbers and facts.
  • You welcome change and thrive in an ever-changing environment. This role will require you to be strategic at times (leading team) and also being tactical (building funnels, writing copy, etc.) 
  • Highly organized, creative, data-driven,  and detail-oriented.
  • Prior experience working with remote teams is a must.

Bonus Points
  • Experience with Self Service SaaS.
  • Experience with Hubspot or Salesforce.
  • Understand ClickFunnel‚Äôs marketing strategies.

Benefits
  • Health, vision, and dental benefits. 
  • $1,500 equipment/home office allowance. 
  • 401k company match-up plan. 
  • Free Credit Monitoring. 
  • Competitive Salary.
  • Unlimited PTO. Take time off when you need it. We trust you!
  • Paid Holidays.
  • 4 weeks of paid Parental Leave.
  • Compassionate Leave, you'll have flexible paid bereavement leave, medical leave, and natural disaster leave.
  • Paid conferences.  We are big fans of continued growth.
  • Learning budget annual benefits, which include a budget for personal development.
  • Profit-Sharing Bonus, we celebrate our hard work and success with monthly profit-sharing distributions.
  • Purpose-driven activities, we donate and participate in activities that promote giving and contributing to good causes.
  • Free access to Nutrition, Yoga, and Fitness classes through Choose Bright.
  • Employee Wellness Program.
  • Unlimited meditation and mindfulness content through your  Premium membership with Insight Timer.
  • Fun perks & monthly activities.
  • A comprehensive and paid onboarding process.
  • The freedom to work from anywhere around the world.
Want to learn more? Visit our careers page https://www.creditrepaircloud.com/careers 

Credit Repair Cloud is an Equal Opportunity Employer and is committed to working with a diverse staff. We hire globally for talent and drive and value members by work deliverables and passion. No matter what race, color, creed, religion, gender, gender identity, gender expression, national origin, citizenship, age, sex, sexual orientation, pregnancy, marital status, ancestry, physical or mental disability, military or veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law, we are all equal here.

We encourage every talented and qualified person to apply. In your application, please feel free to note which pronouns you use (For example - she/her/hers, he/him/his, they/them/theirs, etc.)

Sweden Unlimited is one of the top ecommerce agencies for fashion, lifestyle, luxury and beauty brands. We are searching for a talented and experienced Senior Developer to join our team. This position requires skills in building ecommerce websites using the latest front-end technologies. In this role you will be passionate about writing clean, reusable code with strong emphasis on stability and performance. To be successful in this role you will be organized, great with clients, self-sufficient, and able to deliver on time and according to requirements. 

What you‚Äôll do:

  • Participate in initial client facing intake sessions to determine and document project technical requirements
  • Collaborate with our talented design and project management teams to transform requirements into robust solutions
  • Provide technical advice and input to the scope of work including platform recommendations, hosting, migration, 3rd party plug-ins and overall technical specifications for each project
  • Work to help architect, develop, test and deploy new components & site features for our clients
  • Collaborate with the Creative Team to translate visual designs into responsive front end code
  • Assist with the integration / onboarding of new technologies and applications
  • Provide long term solutions and short term options for common maintenance requests
  • Build out custom Shopify themes and modifying pre-existing themes depending on the scope of the project
  • Implement marketing pixels and client-specific integrations
  • Represent Sweden in a professional manner during sales calls/meetings where technical input necessary
  • Work on multiple projects simultaneously

Skills & Requirements:

  • 4-6 years experience in a professional development environment, with at least 2 years of experience developing custom Shopify themes, agency experience a plus
  • Expertise in Shopify Liquid template language
  • Demonstrate a mastery of HTML, CSS/SCSS & JavaScript; Vue.js and/or React.js experience a plus
  • Well-versed in Git version control system
  • Proficient with best practices in responsive development
  • Proven results in performance-focused development and optimization
  • Fundamental understanding of Shopify and its API / Application ecosystem
  • Familiarity with Wordpress a plus
  • Familiarity with WCAG and accessibility best practices
  • Excellent time management, problem solving, teamwork, and communication skills with ability to stay well-organized between a variety of projects
  • A passion for front-end architecture and learning new technologies
  • Deep understanding of ecommerce solutions, web design, development process, and third party applications
  • Ability to work independently to solve technical problems, mitigate risk, make decisions, and communicate effectively under tight deadlines and challenging situations
  • Ability to work in a small and fast paced boutique environment
  • Experience mentoring and troubleshooting alongside junior and mid-level developers

results.role: Project Manager - Active Network Infrastructure (Ting Internet)

Ting Internet is a leading fiber Internet provider in the United States, delivering future-proof internet in over a dozen Ting Towns across the country.

We are rapidly growing our footprint, and with a national focus on better infrastructure, we don‚Äôt expect to slow down anytime soon!

As part of Tucows (NASDAQ:TCX, TSX:TC), Ting is backed by outstanding resources and talent. We embrace a people-first philosophy that is rooted in respect, trust, and flexibility. We believe that whatever works for our employees is what works best for us. It‚Äôs also why the majority of our roles are remote-first, meaning you can work from anywhere you can connect to the internet!

The work we do genuinely changes lives. If this sounds exciting, we‚Äôd love to hear from you! 

As the Project Manager, Active Network Infrastructure, you will:

  • Lead end-to-end projects deploying ISP fiber network infrastructure in Active Cabinets, Central Offices, and Data Centers
  • Work closely with multi-functional stakeholders to scale up inside plant network deployment velocity and consistency  
  • Support process enablement quick wins as required
Reporting to:

  • Sr. Manager, SFU Build Program
Your responsibilities will include:

  • Managing network equipment construction projects in multiple cities: You‚Äôll be in charge of ensuring those projects are on time and on budget. This will involve working closely with other members from a cross section of internal teams: network architecture, design, implementation and operations. You will interface with local contractors, utility companies and state/county/municipal permitting authorities  
  • Making sure everything is moving according to plan and helping us solve issues when it isn‚Äôt. You will be in the eye of the storm
  • Comfort working in a ‚Äúmature start-up‚Äù environment - you will be jumping into a fast growing upstart business. If you‚Äôre used to and only thrive in a structured, rigorous environment, this gig isn‚Äôt for you
  • Develop and implement project risk management strategies, especially when new markets launches are dependent on the projects you are leading
  • Encourage operational systems thinking between local project team and vendors
  • Champion clear division of responsibilities with all internal and external stakeholders
  • Support process and systems enablement workshops as required
Qualifications:

  • 5+ years of project management experience building telecom core and edge networks and/or data centers 
  • Familiarity with aggregation(XGS PON) and core network technology (MPLS) 
  • Strong versatile communication skills, be it with senior leadership or local operations team member
  • Ability to use standards, guidelines and norms to converse at both a technical and business level
  • Demonstrated knowledge of Internet Service Provider (FTTH ideally) Inside and Outside Plant construction best practices
  • Proven ability to build documentation and processes, and critical metrics
  • Experience managing HVAC and commercial power vendors is a nice to have
  • One or more PMI certification is a plus
Other:

  • Be a positive change agent for the operation
  • US travel up to 20%
 

Want to know more about what we stand for? At Ting and Tucows we care about protecting the open Internet, narrowing digital divide, and supporting fairness and equality.

We also know that diversity drives innovation. We are committed to inclusion across race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status or disability status. We celebrate multiple approaches and diverse points of view.

We will ensure that individuals with disabilities are provided reasonable accommodation to participate in the job application or interview process, to perform essential job functions, and to receive other benefits and privileges of employment. Please contact us to request an accommodation.

Learn more about Tucows, our culture and employee benefits on our site here.

Position Overview: Catch Co. is looking for an Event Planning Intern to assist in the end-to-end execution of an exciting and diverse range of in-person events and activations. Our business continues to evolve and engaging with consumers and partners (like retailers) in the real-world is a critical next step in bringing our unique brands to life. Events will include everything from the Bassmobile mobile tour to industry trade shows and customer meetups.



Details of Internship: 

  • Paid internship opportunity 
  • April-July with a possibility to extend
  • 15+ hours/week
  • Applicants can be located anywhere in the US, but must be willing to travel occasionally for events (travel, meals, and lodging expenses are covered)
  • Applicants must be available to travel to and work at an in-person event July 17-23

What you will do:

  • Assist in the proactive planning, communication, and organization of a wide variety of events, potentially including the Bassmobile mobile tour (ongoing), ICAST (July 19-22), and the Bassmaster Classic (March 4-6).
  • Research and strategize Bassmobile events including sourcing 5 tour stop ideas per week and initial outreach to confirm feasibility. 
  • Coordinate and confirm lodging options for the Bassmobile amBASSadors within one week of a new event being confirmed.
  • Travel, as required, to support successful event execution.
  • Sitting on the marketing team, you will have frequent interaction with the Event Manager and Bassmobile amBASSadors.

What qualifications you need:

  • Pursuing a degree in marketing or a related field
  • Ability to lift and carry 25lbs
  • Ability and willingness to travel occasionally for events

What will make you successful:

  • Excellent Communication
  • Strong Attention to Detail
  • Creativity & Innovation
  • Initiative & Proactivity

Hiring Process: 


We aim to reply to all applicants within a week of receiving your application. Our interview process consists of several stages, each one allowing us to get to know you better, professionally and technically. It is also an opportunity for you to gain a better understanding of our culture and the work we do. The stages include:

  • Resume review 
  • Phone interview 
  • Take home exercise 
  • Interview with Hiring Manager and team members via Google Meet 
  • Background check

What is Catch Co?


At Catch Co, our purpose is to rescue humanity from the indoors by connecting them with America‚Äôs top outdoor sport: fishing. More than 50 million Americans fish every year and Catch Co is the industry leader in creating products, content, and experiences that modern anglers love. Most importantly, we aim to be the industry‚Äôs most data-driven and customer-centric company.


We are building 3 unique businesses to deliver on that mission:

  1. Mystery Tackle Box - Founded in 2012, MTB is the most popular fishing subscription service in the world, with over 5 million boxes shipped (and counting!).
  2. Karl‚Äôs Bait and Tackle - Launched in 2018, Karl‚Äôs is a unique and exciting ecommerce experience that brings the local tackle shop to the Internet.
  3. Catch Co. fishing products - Catch Co also designs and develops some of fishing‚Äôs most popular and innovative brands and products, sold online and in retail throughout the world.

To support these businesses, we have built a best-in-class foundation of creativity, technology, data, and a fun and supportive culture. We have also built durable partnerships with some of the industry‚Äôs most impactful content creators, influencers, product designers, and more. 


As we execute against our mission, our team members remain curious, action-oriented, and collaborative. If that sounds like you, we would love to meet you.


Everybody can fish with us! 


These are our core values:

  • Passion: We love what we do and we take pride in our work.
  • Action: We work hard to get stuff done, with urgency.
  • Optimism: We believe that we will succeed, and we are willing to keep trying new things.
  • Honesty: We tell it like it is, communicate issues, take accountability and use data to make decisions. We are transparent with customers, partners and employees.
  • Curiosity: We look for ways to make things better. We focus on solutions, not problems.
  • #happydance: We create happiness for our customers and for each other.

Our culture is fast-moving, hardworking, welcoming and friendly, and we keep our calendar full of opportunities to learn from coworkers and foster community. We love a good team event (like trivia or Quiplash), continued learning (fireside chats led by colleagues), and niche Slack channels like #mlb, #bachelor, #unpopular_opinions, #badjokes and #smallwins.


Catch Co. is passionate about creating an inclusive workplace that promotes and values diversity. We are proud to be an equal opportunity employer. Catch Co. recruits, employs, trains, compensates and promotes without regard to race, color, religion, sex, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, genetics, disability, age, veteran status or any other protected status.

Our Benefits:
  • "Take what you need" paid time off (PTO) policy
  • 11 paid holidays yearly
  • Fully distributed team (most employees may work from anywhere in the continental United States!)
  • Flexible working schedule
  • Two week-long company retreats per year
  • Medical, Dental and Vision Insurance - we cover 80-100% of the premium for yourself and your dependents 
  • Paid parental leave
  • Employee Assistance Program (EAP)
  • Employee Resource Groups (ERG)
  • Health Savings Accounts and Flexible Spending Accounts
  • Employer-sponsored disability insurance
  • Employer-sponsored life insurance
  • Employee discount program
  • 401(K) plan
  • Pet insurance
  • Pre-tax commuter benefits
  • Free Karl's Club membership, $100 of store credit and free swag
  • And more!

Unfortunately, visa sponsorship is not available at this time.

Are you excited about working for a technology company that is securing the web? Are you looking for full-time, flexible hours* working remotely from anywhere in the United States? If so, this may be your dream job!

$110,000 to $120,000 along with a $15,000 signing bonus.

*Required core hours of 10am - 1pm Pacific Time, Monday through Friday.

Requirements
We must be able to trust that you can grab a bug, do a great job of implementing the required code, and do it in a way that is scalable, secure, bug free, and maintainable. Our release tempo is frequent, and we put a premium on our team being able to produce well engineered software. We're not a bureaucracy. The code you write will be deployed in short order on over 4 million websites, and we need to ensure that our team continues to provide the high standard of engineering our customers have become accustomed to.

Note that this role is for a ‚ÄúDeveloper‚Äù position at Defiant, Inc. We acknowledge that developers improve with time and experience, and our intent with this role is to provide an opportunity for less experienced developers to benefit from mentoring, and potentially grow into a Senior Developer role. If you feel you are already at Senior Developer level, please don‚Äôt hesitate to apply for that position instead. For both roles, you‚Äôll notice that the job requirements are similar, but the interview process for a Senior Developer is more rigorous, and our knowledge requirements are broader and deeper.

Also note that there is no artificial limit on the pace at which team members can advance at Defiant. In other words, advancement at Defiant is not based on time with the company, seniority, or other constraining factors. If you progress quickly, we quickly acknowledge that, and modify your job title and pay as needed. If you join as a Developer, you may grow into a Senior Developer in a matter of months, or it may take a few years.

The specific skills we require for this position are:
  • Development experience with PHP. You've written code that is not only secure but scales to a large number of users.
  • Production experience with MySQL. You've designed database schemas with an emphasis on scalability and performance.
  • Experience working with large amounts of frequently updated data, and designing efficient schemas is a plus.
  • Experience with Apache, NGINX, HAProxy, and/or OpenResty. You've built apps on a LAMP/LEMP stack.
  • Experience with HTML, CSS, and JS. Vue.js and/or Node.js experience is a strong plus.
  • Working knowledge of Git and GitHub. You've collaborated with other developers on a project on GitHub.
  • Experience using Linux systems. You're comfortable using the command line to troubleshoot issues on a server.
  • Experience with AWS is a plus.
  • Understanding of common web vulnerabilities is a plus. You're able to identify vulnerabilities through code reviews.
  • Experience with WordPress is a plus. You've written custom code that utilizes the WordPress API.
  • A keen interest in information security is a plus. Credentials like Security+, CISSP, or others are a strong plus.
  • AWS knowledge of SQS, Glue, CloudFormation, Big Data, ML, Kinesis and Lake Formation are a plus
  • Experience with Laravel is a strong plus.
  • Knowledge of other languages is a strong plus.

All positions require a trial period of approximately 2-3 weeks with a minimum commitment of 10 hours per week. You will be paid for this short-term contract, and it will be used to evaluate whether both parties want to pursue an ongoing, regular employment relationship.

All offers of employment are contingent on successful completion of a background check. The results of the background check are considered as they relate to the position and do not automatically disqualify someone from a offer of employment with the company.

Benefits
  • $15,000 signing bonus
  • Full time telecommuting and flexible working hours, with a company that has been 100% remote for over 8 years.
  • 100% employee premium and 50% of dependent premium paid by company for premier- level medical, dental, and vision insurance.
  • 21 days PTO per year to start.
  • Approximately 12 paid company holidays including the week from December 25 to January 1.
  • 401(k) with a 4% Safe Harbor company match that is 100% vested immediately.
  • Latest in laptop and workstation technology.
  • Wellness reimbursement program for health and fitness purchases.
  • Mobile phone and internet reimbursement up to $100 per month.
  • Monthly beverage reimbursement for coffee, tea, water, etc.
  • Paid training and study time for work-related training and certifications.
  • College tuition reimbursement.

Diversity at Defiant

We value diversity and do not discriminate based on race, color, religion or creed, national origin or ancestry, sex, age, physical or mental disability, military or veteran status, gender identity or expression, marital status, sexual orientation, political ideology, economic status, parental status, or any other non-performance-related status.

Are you excited about working for a technology company that is securing the web? Are you looking for full-time, flexible hours* working remotely from anywhere in the United States, Canada, or UK? If so, this may be your dream job!

Salary is $120,000 - $150,000 along with a one time $20,000 signing bonus.

*Required core hours of 10am - 1pm Pacific Time

Requirements 

We must be able to trust that you can grab a bug, do a great job of implementing the required code and do it in a way that is scalable, secure, bug free and maintainable. Our release tempo is frequent, and we put a premium on our team being able to produce well engineered software. We're not a bureaucracy. The code you write will be deployed in short order on over 3 million websites and we need to ensure that our team continues to provide the high standard of engineering our customers have become accustomed to.

The specific skills we require for this position are:
  • Significant development experience with PHP. You've written code that is not only secure but scales to a large number of users. 
  • Production experience with MySQL. You've designed database schemas with an emphasis on scalability and performance.
  • Experience working with large amounts of frequently updated data, and designing efficient schemas, is a plus.
  • Experience with Apache, NGINX, HAProxy, and/or OpenResty. You've built apps on a LAMP/LEMP stack.
  • Experience with HTML, CSS, and JS. Vue.js and/or Node.js experience is a strong plus.
  • Working knowledge of Git and GitHub. You've collaborated with other developers on a project on GitHub.
  • Experience using Linux systems. You're comfortable using the command line to troubleshoot issues on a server.
  • Experience with AWS. You've built apps that run and scale in AWS.
  • Understanding of common web vulnerabilities. You're able to identify vulnerabilities through code reviews.
  • Experience with WordPress. You've written custom code that utilizes the WordPress API.
  • A keen interest in infosec. Credentials like Security+, CISSP or other is a strong plus.
  • Knowledge of other languages a strong plus.
Nice to Haves:
  • AWS - SQS, Glue, CloudFormation, Big Data, ML, Kinesis, Lake Formation
  • Experience with Laravel is a strong plus.
All positions require a trial period of approximately 2-3 weeks with a minimum commitment of 10 hours per week. You will be paid for this short-term contract, and it will be used to evaluate whether both parties want to pursue an ongoing, regular employment relationship.

All offers of employment are contingent on successful completion of a background check. The results of the background check are considered as they relate to the position and do not automatically disqualify someone from a offer of employment with the company.

Benefits

  • One time $20,000 signing bonus.
  • Full time telecommuting and flexible working hours, with a company that has been 100% remote for over 8 years.
  • 100% employee premium and 50% of dependent premium paid by company for premier- level medical, dental, and vision insurance.
  • 21 days PTO per year to start.
  • Approximately 12 paid company holidays including the week from December 25 to January 1.
  • 401(k) with a 4% Safe Harbor company match that is 100% vested immediately.
  • Latest in laptop and workstation technology.
  • Wellness reimbursement program for health and fitness purchases.
  • Mobile phone and internet reimbursement up to $100 per month.
  • Monthly beverage reimbursement for coffee, tea, water, etc.
  • Paid training and study time for work-related training and certifications.
  • College tuition reimbursement.

Diversity at Defiant

We value diversity and do not discriminate based on race, color, religion or creed, national origin or ancestry, sex, age, physical or mental disability, military or veteran status, gender identity or expression, marital status, sexual orientation, political ideology, economic status, parental status, or any other non-performance-related status.

COMPANY INTRO

Giftbit. Simple, remarkable rewards.

Giftbit makes it easy to manage digital rewards and incentive programs. We offer a web application and API that allows businesses to customize, automate, and track rewards. Learn more at www.giftbit.com.

Giftbit‚Äôs powerful platform and compelling customer experience are made by our dynamic team. To guide our actions, the Giftbit team has defined eight cultural principles that help us in our daily work and decision making. What we do is who we are. Learn more about these principles here.

THE ROLE

As the Customer Success Lead, you will oversee the growth and satisfaction of existing Giftbit customers. You will advocate for them to help Giftbit deliver a remarkable experience measured by NPS, retention, and CSAT. This role works closely with other stakeholders in Customer Experience (marketing, onboarding, and support). So, you will inform the overall CX strategy and provide critical input to Giftbit‚Äôs product team to inform roadmap. You will be the primary relationship holder to Giftbit‚Äôs largest customers and will turn more of our happy customers into promoters. This role reports to the Head of Marketing and oversees the Customer Support team.

WHAT YOU‚ÄôLL DO

  • In partnership with marketing and onboarding, you will help to unlock the story for more growth through case studies, testimonials, and reviews.
  • Own automations for nurturing and engagement by:
    • Identifying opportunities and creating engagement campaigns
    • Creating messaging based on vertical streams and success activity goals
    • Identifying contact behaviour using automation tools
    • Using customer scoring to help us get more evangelists.
  • Manage the contact database through list segmentation, property tagging, lifecycle stages, contact vs company etc.
  • Maintain accounts through building a rapport with key customers for growth and retention, identifying emerging key customers and intentionally nurturing them.
  • Own key metrics for role (growth, retention, and churn).
  • Oversee the support team to deliver a great customer experience.

WHAT YOU CAN BRING

  • Customer Success experience for a B2B product
  • Enthusiasm and motivation. You are self-driven
  • Good judgement and ability to make a difference in ambiguous situations
  • Blend of empathy and storytelling
  • Strong written communication
  • Foundation for effectively leading an ancillary team
  • Proven ability to understand customer‚Äôs individual motivation and success, as well as those of their business
  • Healthy respect for clean data

EXTRAS WE‚ÄôD VALUE TOO

  • Knowledge and experience with automation tools and CRM (especially Hubspot and Intercom)
  • Previously responsible for a metric that can be mapped to success in this role (retention, customer growth, churn, NPS, CSAT)
  • Past experience with account management
  • Experience with email and chat marketing campaigns
  • Previous management experience
  • A history of speaking with customers via phone or video chat

OPPORTUNITIES AT GIFTBIT

One of our 8 Cultural Principles is adopting a growth mindset. We invest in the professional development of our team. You will have opportunities to grow your skill and perspective with education, conferences, and relevant training.

Work at Giftbit is meant to support success and prosperity in the fullness of your life. We promote holistic self-care and health. We support flexible workspace options. We celebrate the diversity of people‚Äôs strengths in an inclusive team environment that embraces learning and improvement.
Financial compensation at Giftbit rewards growth, performance, and teamwork. We pay people based on experience and proficiency to clear industry benchmarks and market standards. The salary range for this role is $80,000-$100,000, depending on candidate experience.

YOUR APPLICATION

We welcome candidates living in Canada to apply. Giftbit is a diverse team of people who mainly work in the Pacific time zone. We require resumes and cover letters to be submitted by each candidate. All candidates will be considered in a fair and inclusive process. Only candidates selected for interviews will be contacted.

Freelance work is defining developer careers in exciting new ways. If you‚Äôre passionate about finding rapid career growth potential working with leading Fortune 500 brands and innovative Silicon Valley startups, Toptal could be a great fit for your next career shift.

Toptal is an elite talent network made up of the world‚Äôs top 3% of developers, connecting the best and brightest freelancers with top organizations. Unlike a 9-to-5 job, you‚Äôll choose your own schedule and work from anywhere. Jobs come to you, so you won‚Äôt bid for projects against other developers in a race to the bottom. Plus, Toptal takes care of all the overhead, empowering you to focus on successful engagements while getting paid on time, at the rate you decide, every time. Our sophisticated screening process makes sure you are provided with top clients without additional overhead, as well as assistance in maximizing the potential of your full-time freelance career. Joining the Toptal network also gives you access to technical training programs, mentors, and coaching programs, so you can connect with a global community of experts like you to share peer-to-peer knowledge and expand your network globally.

As a freelance developer, you can become a part of an ever-expanding community of experts in over 120 countries, working remotely on projects that meet your career ambitions.

That‚Äôs why the world‚Äôs top 3% of developers choose Toptal. Developers in our network share: * English language proficiency * 3+ years of professional experience in software development * Solid experience with React.js, Ruby on Rails, Go or/and Node.js is a strong advantage * Project management skills * A keen attention to detail * Experience with system architecture or leading a software team is a strong advantage * Full-time availability is a strong advantage
