Summary

Hi!  I‚Äôm the founder of Builder Prime, a growing B2B SaaS startup helping home improvement companies grow their businesses.  We‚Äôre a small, but profitable and rapidly growing company and we are looking to make our next strategic hire to support and further accelerate our growth.

We put a ton of attention and hard work into our product, and we‚Äôve built the absolute best platform out there for home improvement contractors.  Our customers love our software and the support they receive from us.  Check out our reviews on Capterra and Facebook to see what some of our customers are saying about us. 

This is a full-time position that is almost 100% remote.  The vast majority of our meetings, as well as your meetings with customers will be online.  There may be some requirement for in-person meetings, but they will be infrequent and travel will be optional during the pandemic.

Why YOU Should Apply

This is a unique opportunity to work with a software startup company that is still at a relatively early stage.  We are profitable, growing rapidly, and we have already secured funding to further accelerate our growth.  It‚Äôs OK if you haven‚Äôt been in a position exactly like this before.  In this position, you will learn what it takes to build a successful company and use that to grow in your role here, or start your own company in the future. 

You will be working directly with our Director of Customer Success and Inbound Sales, as well as with me, the founder/developer.  You will be able to influence and make real change, and see the results of those changes immediately.  You will learn what it takes to build software that actually makes a huge difference in businesses and that people love to use every single day.

Responsibilities and Day-to-Day

Your number one priority in this role will be to help grow the company by converting inbound leads into paying customers.  You will engage with prospects who have signed up for a free trial or requested a product demo, and show them how to be successful with the software so they continue on as paid subscribers.  

While we do have a sales process and we will continue to evolve that process, we are not a hard sales organization.  We know that we will provide the customer with exceptional return on their investment with us, and we just need to help them achieve that. 
  
You will perform product demos and walkthroughs, help customers with setting up their own instance of the app, and train users to increase engagement with the various capabilities of the software.  You will also have the primary responsibility for the relationship with that customer on an ongoing basis to ensure their continued success with the software.
 
As you will be spending a significant portion of your time speaking with existing and prospective customers, you will be learning all about the problems they are facing and what is important to them.  With this information in hand, we will work together on the product roadmap to prioritize new features and capabilities to be built into the system based on the direct feedback you are receiving.  Despite our small team size, we build lightning fast with new features and updates rolling out constantly, so it will be fun to watch the evolution of the app, and to delight customers with the kind of speed that makes them feel like this was built just for them.
 
You will have a great opportunity to learn about and contribute to many different areas of the business.  In addition to engaging with customers and influencing product development, you will take on various side projects as a secondary responsibility based on your strengths and interests.  

Through these side projects you will have the opportunity contribute to building out other systems and processes that will make your primary job easier, and ultimately help you be more successful in acquiring new customers and supporting existing ones.  For example, you might:
  • develop new onboarding workflows, 
  • create new user guides and documentation, 
  • enhance or create drip email campaigns and email copy to improve user engagement and conversion,
  • create video and written content for blogs and social media, 
  • and more. 

Requirements

In this role, you will need to take complete ownership over your assigned leads and customers.  You will be given all of the tools and support to be successful without being told what to do every step of the way.  If this appeals to you, then this may be the perfect position for you.
 
Here are some other qualifications that would make this role a good fit for you: 

You have direct experience working at a home improvement company in an administrative, production, or sales role.  We get pretty deep with our customers on helping them grow their businesses, so it really helps to understand how these kinds of companies should (or shouldn‚Äôt) operate.
 
- OR - 

You have at least 2 years of experience in a SaaS customer success and/or sales role. 

Additionally: 
  • You have a reliable and fast internet connection. 
  • You demonstrate friendliness and empathy when conversing with customers and other people, and can relate well to a variety of different people. 
  • You are comfortable proclaiming that you are tech savvy.  You don‚Äôt need to be a developer, but you should be able to learn how to use new software products quickly and deeply. 
  • You love the idea of efficiency.  You are constantly driving to make yourself more efficient, and the idea of making other people more efficient excites you. 
  • You are able to articulate how technology solutions can improve lives and improve business. 
  • You love to learn, and you love finding new ways to get things done better and faster. 
  • You have excellent written and verbal communication. 

We can‚Äôt wait to work with you and build something truly amazing!

About Us

Discourse is a global company with a product that is 100% open source. Our team is 60 people and growing, and we‚Äôre excited to bring on our first account executive who will report to our Chief Operating Officer and own all enterprise sales!


Discourse is transforming the online community space. Our product powers a substantial segment of successful online communities, with >30,000 Discourse instances globally. We have thousands of paying customers, with a growing number of Fortune 500 companies on our list, alongside many leading players in the fast-growth technology, gaming and blockchain/web3 spaces.

About the Job

Responsibilities
  • Managing inbound sales leads
  • Coordinating pre-sales resources throughout the sales cycle
  • Consulting with prospects to determine the best solution for their specific needs
  • Providing online presentations, product demonstrations and general support to prospective customers
  • Responding to customer RFP requests
  • Structuring bespoke deals and compiling appropriate contractual paperwork
  • Discovering and communicating customer requirements to the engineering and customer success teams

Qualifications
  • 3+ years of experience in enterprise software or SAAS sales
  • Experience developing and leading prospects by understanding and solving specific business issues
  • The ability to ‚Äúdrive a deal‚Äù and go beyond relationship management
  • Outstanding leadership, relationship building, and influencing skills.
  • A knack for implementing processes, technologies, and solutions for a fast-paced environment
  • Excellent communication skills whether it be on the phone, on instant messaging apps, video conferencing, email, or speaking in front of large groups
  • An overwhelming level of enthusiasm for building relationships and delivering on promise
At Discourse, the ability to communicate well in writing is paramount. We use our own software, Discourse, for most communication and most of your interaction with customers and team members will be in writing. In order to live these values, we look for folks who are:
  • Detail-oriented, proactive, and organized
  • Able to make decisions quickly and communicate effectively
  • Work well independently and remotely
  • Kind to their co-workers
  • Highly driven with an execution focus and a strong belief in our mission to make the internet a better place.
  • While not a necessity, prior experience with open source software or community management is an advantage

About our Benefits

We believe that high-quality benefits make our team more effective. We‚Äôve been thoughtful about our benefits package which include a completely flexible schedule, 5 weeks of vacation per year, funding for a co-working stipend, and much more!

Lastly, we believe in having a welcoming workplace where people with diverse backgrounds and cultures can create something great together. We encourage you to apply, even if you don‚Äôt meet every qualification! Apply by sending a cover letter and resume to jobs@discourse.org.

Salary

Projected range is $110-140k + bonus (17%) + equity plan

Job description

As a design master for our team, you‚Äôll play a critical role in fulfilling the Bonfire Effect mission: helping companies fuel business growth by attracting, engaging, and maintaining customers by building authentic relationships. You‚Äôll digest the asks of creative briefs and expand those ideas into your own creations. You‚Äôll partner with our Creative Director (copywriter) to lead and develop beautiful, compelling campaigns and brand strategies. All the while working your Adobe Creative Suite magic in a fun, people-centered environment that will fan your creative and personal fire.

Full time remote position
Are you a quick learner when it comes to new technologies, frameworks, or libraries? Do you want to work with the latest technologies used in the blockchain world? If you answered yes to most of the questions, then we are looking forward to working with you.

You will be joining a fast moving company, highly technical team that has deep knowledge of DeFi and all the cool things from the blockchain ecosystem.

Responsibilities
  • Implement full fledged and performant UI for web3 apps with beautiful designs.
  • Create trustworthy user experiences by building interfaces that are simple, easy to comprehend, performant and reliable
  • Discuss and adapt designs with the design team
  • Integrate your own UI/UX improvements to incentivize the users to use the platform.
  • Integrate external services with app in an efficient manner
  • Lead the development team and guarantee quality products are shipped consistently according to the roadmap created.
  • Provide support to the development team: answer technical questions, propose different approaches to solve technical problems, train new employees.
  • Work together with the Project Manager to assign and organize the workload within the team.
  • Lead and participate in audit sessions (and create remediation documents) and follow Agile-like processes.
  • Document the requirements and the architecture and design proposed to provide the software solution. 
  • Provide project status information to the other stakeholders.
  • Overall project drive and steering from a technical perspective.
  • Promote and build collaboration, accountability and responsibility spirit within the team. 
  • Work with the state of the art developer stack.
  • Continually learn and apply relevant software development practices, patterns, tools and technologies.

Requirements & skills
  • 5+ years of programming experience.
  • Excellent knowledge of React framework including React hooks, React context, React redux and more..
  • Excellent knowledge of CSS.
  • Previous experience managing distributed/remote teams.
  • Self-motivated with a high level of autonomy.
  • Excellent communication skills as our entire team is remote.
  • Advanced English proficiency. 

Bonus points:
  • Knowledge of Material UI v5
  • Experience working in DeFi frontend development - understand the flow of the web3 application
  • Understand the interaction between frontend and solidity contracts (i.e. ethers.js, web3-react)

Perks
  • Competitive Crypto payments, all made in USDC. 
  • 100% remote work. No geographic restrictions. 
  • An entrepreneurial environment that encourages innovation and facilitates the growth of cutting-edge technology. 
  • The ability to work as an independent contractor: We treat you as your own agent and support you accordingly!
  • Annual Working Equipment Allowance.
  • Monthly Gym & Fitness Bonus
  • Paid Absence Days
  • Global WeWork membership, with access to more than 600 locations worldwide.
  • Annual personal development funding to facilitate career development
  • Diversity & Inclusion: A company commitment to equal opportunity. We do not condone discrimination on the premise of race, color, religion, sexual orientation, age, gender identity or expression.

Lucyd Media offers creative advertising to companies in the CBD/Cannabis space that maintain a socially conscious mission. We are looking for a creative advertising designer to design still and motion social media ads for our DTC clients. 

As the Creative Coordinator at Lucyd, you will support and lead the creative team on the day-to-day execution of ad creation and delivery. In this role, you will lead and direct the creative team, as well as work closely with cross-functional team members such as Program Managers and Media Buyers.
This position is front-and-center in the strategy, creation, development, and execution of all Lucyd‚Äôs advertisements. The right person for this role is energized by working in a fast-paced creative environment and possesses a strong ability to handle multiple tasks concurrently while prioritizing and following through on vital projects.

This person should have a robust attention to detail and the ability to analyze and interpret data to derive insights. If you love advertising and branding as much as we do, have a passion for the health/wellness industry, and attack every single day with a ‚Äòcan do‚Äô attitude, a one team mentality, and a desire to continuously improve, then we at Lucyd can't wait to hear from you!

A Day in The Life Typically Includes:

  • Providing creative ad direction for designers and investors
  • Manage the day-to-day ad routing and review processes among creatives, program managers, investors, leadership, and others.
  • Lead creative kickoffs meetings and collect, maintain, organize, and distribute creative assets and folders.
  • Track project status and monitor deadlines; manage expectations and promptly communicate and solve issues (escalating, if needed).
  • Coordinate and process new ad request as well as any further revisions.
  • Schedule meetings, take notes, and distribute next steps as needed.
  • Provide compliance guidance for internal and external stakeholders.
  • Research and ideate new ads and concepts to pitch to investors
  • Analyze, track, and digest which ad creatives are performing for investors.

What You Will Need:

Basic Qualifications: Bachelor‚Äôs degree, or equivalent experience, in communications, editorial, marketing, or a related area.

Possess excellent:

  • Organizational and time management skills
  • Communication skills, verbal and written
  • Technical and administrative skills
  • Attention to detail, with the ability to proofread and oversee Quality Assurance
  • Experience in creative management, production, or a related area.
  • Self-starter, with the ability to work independently and collaboratively.
  • Flexible, adaptable, and able to thrive in a fast-paced environment.

What Will Put You Ahead?

Preferred Qualifications:

  • Coursework in project management, production management, organizational management, or related field.
  • Experience creating and updating content for websites, newsletters, blogs, video, and/or social.
  • Experience working with: project management tools (for example, Monday, Notion, Slack, Google Suites)
  • Familiarity with the health and wellness industry, creative development, and advertising

Recruiting Lead

Getro is looking for a full life cycle Technical Recruiter to work with our hiring managers to source, screen, and support us in creating an amazing candidate experience. This team member would form part of our core team (first 20 employees), and help us scale the team 2X over the next 9 months. 


About You, as an expert: 
  • 5+ year‚Äôs experience with min 1 year hiring for technical roles, especially engineers and product managers (we work with Ruby on the backend, React on the front) 
  • Experience hiring in both the US and international markets - we hire from PST to CET 
  • Experience sourcing and hiring technical talent outside of the US
  • This is an execution role, you‚Äôre a do-er as well as a thinker 
  • We also value, but don‚Äôt require, experience in hiring in non technical roles, onboarding, culture, employee wellbeing, performance management systems  
  • This role can be a growth path into a more holistic Talent practitioner‚Ä¶ grow with the team you are helping us to build! 



About You, as a person: 
  • You are highly driven and proactive - you make things happen
  • You are detail & process oriented
  • You are a proactive communicator and team player
  • You practice committed ownership - you own your projects from beginning to end, you ask for buy-in to make better decisions, but aren‚Äôt paralyzed without it. When things go wrong, you accept accountability for your part without blaming others, and share your learnings openly
  • You live between the PST and CEST time zones 



72 Hours in Your Life:
  • Using Greenhouse to check in on the status and health of our open roles 
  • Interviewing a hiring manager & leadership to help scope a new role and write a job description, driving alignment across various stakeholders
  • Spending time on networks (including proprietary tools!), job boards, candidate databases, and other platforms sourcing exceptional candidates
  • Meeting with our Director of Operations to reevaluate the strategy on what our priority roles are, and action plans where our pipeline is too weak
  • Kick off meeting with a hiring manager to decide the technical requirements, interview process, and ownership of each step 
  • 4 interviews with Engineering candidates & an SDR to help us reach our hiring goals before the end of the quarter (10 hires left to go! ‚Ä¶with you 9 üòâ)
  • Emailing candidates to let them know next steps and feedback 
  • Performing a reference check to clarify a concern we had in a decision meeting
  • Preparing offer letters and employment agreements for candidates we want to hire
  • Designing a standard onboarding process for new joiners 
  • Updating our Employee Handbook with feedback from a new hire 

 


Getro Perks: 
  • 100% remote, 100% flexible 
  • Salary: $83-119k
  • Why the range? We're open to different levels of experience for this role, but still want to publish a salary range to make sure we're not wasting anyone‚Äôs time - we decide salaries based on experience level and cost of living where you're based 
  • Generous Employee Stock Options with an attractive strike price
  • Unlimited vacation
  • Unique culture: humans first, unicorn dreams second 
  • Healthcare & coworking allowance
  • Leadership opportunity to impact the company direction as one of the first 30 employees 

 


About Getro: 

Getro is on a mission to become the platform of choice for making professional introductions by combining technology and human empathy. 


That‚Äôs nice, what do you do, though? 


We have two products:
  • GetroJobs, which automatically aggregates jobs across a network of companies;
  • GetroNetwork, which allows talent (active and passive job seekers) and companies to connect with one another, facilitating introductions and referrals within networks. 

Together our products provide all the quality that comes from a referral vs hundreds of faceless Linkedin profiles, with a UX that is built for employers, not recruiters, and doing away with all of the emailing, calls, and reminders that usually go into a referral request.



Our customers: 

We help 500+ independent professional networks ‚Äî including venture capital funds (Kleiner Perkins), accelerators (TechStars), membership communities (Women 2.0), economic development organizations  (Techleap.nl), universities (University of Toronto), and more ‚Äî make better introductions for their members, measure the outcomes of their intros, and in some cases, make money. 


Our team: 
  • Techstars 2017 graduates
  • Our co-founders have been working together in the recruiting space for the 'last 10 years. They‚Äôve seen some things. 
  • Remote-first company, from 2018 (before covid) 
  • 22 team members across 9 countries 
  • As a fully remote company, we don't have offices, but we do get together virtually and in person Summits (before the pandemic: Germany, Cape Town, San Fran...)  

How we work:

We're ambitious, but realistic - we know anything worth doing takes time. We trust each member of our team to work when they wish, and from a location they choose. We believe in working smarter, not harder - we don't value presentee-ism and we're not impressed by long working hours. Above all, we value the contribution of each individual and take seriously our responsibility to enable you to work on things you love. These aren't just words - they're part of everything we do, including how we design our products.

About Getro


Getro is on a mission to become the platform of choice for making and receiving professional introductions by combining technology and empathy. We have two products:

  • GetroJobs, which automatically aggregates open jobs across a network of companies and;
  • GetroNetwork, which allows talent (active and passive searchers) and companies to find one another, facilitating introductions and referrals within networks. 

Together our products provide all of the quality that comes from a referral vs hundreds of faceless Linkedin profiles, with a UX that is built for employers, not recruiters, and doing away with all of the emailing, calls, and reminders that usually go into a referral request.


Our customers include over 500 communities and independent professional networks ‚Äî like venture capital funds (Kleiner Perkins), accelerators (TechStars), membership communities (Women 2.0), government associations (Techleap.nl), universities (University of Toronto), and more. They use our software to make better introductions for their community members, measure the outcomes of their intros, and in some cases, make money. 


We're are hyper-motivated, but realistic - we know anything worth doing takes time. We trust each member of our team to work when they wish, and from a location they choose. We believe in working smarter, not harder - we don't value presentee-ism and we're not impressed by long working hours. Above all, we value the contribution of each individual and take seriously our responsibility to enable you to work on things you love. These aren't just words - they're part of everything we do, including how we design our products.


Position Overview


We're hiring a Lead Backend Engineer to form part of our core team (first 25 employees). This is a career-defining opportunity to lead the development and scaling of our systems as we move to Series A and beyond, from hundreds of customers to thousands, and from millions of data points to billions. This role has a pathway towards CTO (pending your career goals). 


In your first 6 months, you will‚Ä¶.

  • Successfully be onboarded to our team, product vision, product and stack.
  • Lead our efforts to improve the efficiency and reliability of our data aggregation and validation systems.
  • Audit the scalability of our systems and set a roadmap for success, ensuring other engineers understand and buy into your vision.
  • Collaborate with our Lead Infrastructure Engineer to migrate our backend to AWS.
  • Be hands on, writing well-formulated, well-tested and readable code.
  • Mentor senior developers through code reviews and with proactive feedback.
  • Work with Product and senior members of the org to prioritize the technical roadmap and direct team-level priorities.

In your first year, you will‚Ä¶.

  • Lay the technical foundations for our 10x growth this year in users and data.
  • Cultivate an excellent and inclusive engineering culture by introducing best practices and helping others maintain a high bar and be their best selves at work.
  • Help us to attract and hire a data science team, and support them in building production ready ML services.
  • Support senior leadership through our Series A.

You will thrive in this role, if you...

  • Have 7+ years of experience in building software, especially in Ruby and RoR.
  • Are an expert in systems architecture, schema design and data pipelines.
  • Have been part of a team responsible for scaling at a startups before.
  • Get the details right, can look ahead to anticipate challenges before they arise, and generally practice extreme ownership.
  • Are motivated to foster a high performing engineering environment where your colleagues feel safe, supported and valued. 
  • Seek out simplicity in code, processes, and products.
  • Are product and business minded, comfortable making difficult tradeoffs and a proactive communicator and team player.
  • Communicate clearly in both English and in code.
  • Want to help bring about a positive change in society.

Benefits and Perks

  • Salary: $120,000 - $150,000 depending on experience
  • Generous employee stock options with an attractive strike price
  • 100% remote-first since 2008, 100% flexible. 
  • Unlimited vacation
  • Unique culture: Humans first, unicorn dreams second.
  • We get together virtually and in person for company summits.
  • Healthcare & coworking allowance
  • Be one of the first 25 employees driving real impact. No cogs here.

Job description

What This Position Is All About:
We're looking for an experienced Sr. UX Researcher to join our growing UX design and research organization. In this role, you‚Äôll work with a multidisciplinary team of engineers, product managers, and business partners to deliver exceptional experiences for our customers.

This organization builds the Saks OFF 5TH website, apps, and OMNI channel experiences. We're looking for someone who can bring in fresh insights, solve complex customer problems, and is ready to roll up their sleeves to get things done.

What You‚Äôll Do:
Design, coordinate, execute, and monitor usability studies to develop and validate our product roadmap
Present customer stories with actionable insights, then workshop the findings with product teams and other stakeholders to drive product decisions
Go deep on customer insights, analytics and competitive intelligence to identify unseen opportunities
Partner with design peers, product, engineering, QA, and other stakeholders to develop and execute the product roadmap
Provide assets, specifications, and guidance for implementation of the user interface through the development process.
Grow the UXR team's expertise and operations; explore new ways to discover user insights, build templates and processes, and help teams understand and apply best practices

You Have:
-A Bachelor‚Äôs degree in Human Factors, Human-Computer Interaction, Psychology or a related field (Master‚Äôs preferred) and 6+ years of experience
-Experience using moderated and unmoderated testing, and familiarity with remote testing software
-A strong command of a broad set of qualitative and quantitative user research methods with the ability to discern and recommend the right method(s) for a project.
-Strong communication skills and the ability to present research findings to diverse audiences through written reports and in-person presentations
-Practical expertise in experimental design for qualitative research, user-centered design methodology, data analysis, reporting, and communicating results.

Your Life and Career at Saks OFF 5TH:
Be part of an empowered, innovative team; work with an adventurous spirit and a customer-centric mindset; play a critical role in making decisions that will position us to win
Exposure to rewarding career advancement opportunities across different functions within our corporate offices, retail stores, photo studios, and distribution centers
Benefits package for all eligible full-time employees (including medical, dental and vision)
An amazing employee discount and other exciting perks
Qualifications
Thank you for your interest with Saks OFF 5TH. We look forward to reviewing your application.

Saks OFF 5TH provides equal employment opportunities (EEO) to all employees and applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, age, disability or genetics. In addition to federal law requirements, Saks OFF 5TH complies with applicable state and local laws governing nondiscrimination in employment in every location in which the company has facilities. This policy applies to all terms and conditions of employment, including recruiting, hiring, placement, promotion, termination, layoff, recall, transfer, leaves of absence, compensation and training.

Saks OFF 5TH welcomes all applicants for this position. Should you be individually selected to participate in an assessment or selection process, accommodations are available upon request in relation to the materials or processes to be used.

results.role: Senior Director Talent Acquisition - Fully Remote
results.text:
We're a rapidly growing 100% remote $60MM+ metabolic optimization company seeking a gifted talent acquisition leader to be the face of our company, build our employer brand and recruit top talent who fits with our culture to expand our world class team. This is an extraordinary opportunity for an experienced executive recruiter who loves building systems and processes to 100% own optimizing our entire hiring machine from A-Z. Our entire leadership team will support you however you need as you will be the main growth catalyst to propel us toward our goal of becoming a billion-dollar brand by 2025. We are a 100% remote global team of 200+ and have grown 300%+ in the last 3 years.

Hello, my name is Jason Collett, Head of People for Metabolic, and I need your help. For the last 11 years we've been systematically building different pieces of our MetabolicOS - our ecosystem of offerings that empower people to optimize their metabolism to feel their best, look their best, perform their best and live longer. We're now weaving these disparate elements together to create a unified experience that combines exercise, nutrition, habit change, supplements, coaching and community. This ambitious goal requires we secure uniquely fantastic human capital, which is where you come in.

What Does the Ideal Candidate Look Like?

We are not seeking just any recruiter - we need a strong leader who has built talent acquisition teams before. Someone who is steeped in the art and science of reading people, systemizing processes, and is a magnet for the high-performing, happy, humble, hungry people who define our culture. You get a thrill flexing your "sales muscle" when you land a top talent as recruiter, flourish flexing your "marketing muscle" when activating an employer brand on company and 3rd-party websites and get energized while flexing your "EQ muscle" when coaching hiring managers on your optimized process.

You jump out of bed early with ideas on how to build a full cycle recruiting machine, backed by people, process and technology. You are invigorated in this competitive market because you know you will win, finding the best candidate every time. You have the wisdom and background to navigate and legally document our hiring practices consistently. You have 10-12+ years' experience successfully recruiting top talent, building employer brands, and have goose bumps reading this description because every fiber of you wants to "do it" (hands on recruiting) while you "build it" (create the machine).

Just as importantly, you're extremely into health, wellness and/or fitness. You love experimenting with new habits, realize how critically important having an optimized daily routine is and simply can't get enough of this stuff. Perhaps you've had a health challenge that got you interested, or you've just always been highly passionate about health, wellness and fitness. Either way, your eyes are lighting up at the possibility of aligning your personal passion with your professional superpower.

If you're getting that stars-aligned feeling of "this feels like it is written just for me", please read on.

What are the Key Points?

  • Compensation: $150k - $200k + Bonus
  • Location: 100% Remote (virtual team of 200+ with no corporate office)
  • Benefits: Health/Dental/Vision/Disability/Life + Matching 401k + Unlimited PTO
  • Hours: 8:30 a.m. to 5:00 p.m. EASTERN (to standardize our rhythms)
  • Culture: Human-first with High-Performing, Happy & Humble People (no jerks)
  • Personality: Obsessed with Details so We can Simplify the Complex for Others

What Will You Be Working On?

  • Build Recruiting Machine - You'll optimize our recruiting machine, lead the screenings, optimize the ATS, refine our sourcing tactics, own the outsourced partnerships with headhunters and recruiters, orchestrate our job board networks and hire your own support team.
  • Grow Employer Brand - You'll get to grow our employer brand from scratch, architecting our career and job posting pages internally, while working with external websites to activate our brand, bring it to life and show the world why Metabolic is a phenomenal place to work.
  • Deliver Results - You'll deliver the top talent we need to really lean into our ambitious vision to make living healthy easier than living unhealthy. It won't be easy, it's a tall order, but with your help, we'll chip away at it with the collective force of the amazing team you source.

What's Our Culture Like?

We're serious about high-performance, so our culture is built around deep work to allow uninterrupted time for the focus needed to deliver world-class performance. We also focus on real collaboration and transparency to keep us all in alignment and keep office politics out. These aren't just talking points - we've implemented specific policies, for example:

  • A standardized 8:30 to 5:00 p.m. ET schedule to protect your personal and family time
  • No standing meetings before 1 p.m. ET to empower you with 4 hours of truly deep work to GSD
  • Daily huddles and weekly check-ins to brainstorm, align on priorities and remove bottlenecks
  • No meetings the first week of the month to gain momentum for the month ahead

Who Are We and How Are We Different?

Our mission is simple: make living healthy easier than living unhealthy. We do that by empowering people to fix their own health with our metabolism-first approach and unified ecosystem that powers our MetabolicOS. 3 things make us different than other brands in the health and wellness space:

  • Metabolism-First - After 11 years of trial-and-error with 500k+ people, we've found optimizing your metabolism delivers the results you want: feeling your best, looking your best, performing your best and living longer. Your metabolism is your inner compass for health, but most people don't understand how to read it; once you do, it'll tell you exactly what to do to help you thrive.
  • Individualized-Approach - Paleo may work great for one person's metabolism, Vegan for another, Keto for another, etc. Everyone's different, so to achieve results that stick, those differences must be respected; if not, things will backfire. That's why our approach is 100% customized to the individual - there is no perfect program to find, it must be built to support how that specific person's unique metabolism works. This is where the usual one-size-fits-all solutions fail - they don't respect our very real individual differences.
  • Integrated Ecosystem - It's simply too hard to live healthy - lots of great individual solutions, but nothing is connected. We're left to stitch everything together, which is confusing. We simplify everything with an integrated suite of the offerings you need to optimize your metabolism. We started with nutrition, then exercise, then supplements, then coaching and are constantly pulling in new pieces of the health puzzle.

We power up this 3-pronged approach with our proprietary Metabolic Optimization System (MetabolicOS) that unites practitioner wisdom and scientific research with ML/AI to deliver a truly customized data-driven consumer experience that helps you dial in your metabolism at any stage of life.

What's Our Past and Future?

Our company may be a bit confusing at first glance because we built everything organically in reverse, starting with our first nutrition program in 2012, then our first exercise program in 2014 and then launching our full ecosystem of products, including nutraceuticals, functional foods, subscriptions, memberships, 1-on-1 coaching and more. We market these all separately under different DTC websites.

However, now everything's being centralized under our new brand, Metabolic. We're launching our flagship e-comm website on Metabolic.com in Q2 and our digital product + e-comm app in Q3. Normally, companies raise money, launch with a brand and then figure out how to make money later. We did that in reverse - creating products that solve specific problems first to bootstrap, scaling that up to fund building out our team and infrastructure, and then retrofitting the brand on top.

#LI-DNI

Requirements

  • 7-10 Years' Talent Acquisition Leadership - You've architected recruiting machines A-Z including building employer brands, constructing sourcing pipelines, optimizing ATSs, documenting processes, and leveraging networks through Indeed, LinkedIn, Glassdoor, etc.
  • Strong Executive Recruiter - You have a phenomenal executive presence that people are naturally attracted to, a refined communication and presentation skillset, deft salary negotiation ability, and fine-tuned charisma to comfortably represent the "face" of Metabolic
  • Hands-on Skills and Desire - Not just comfortable but energized with the opportunity to both be extremely hands-on initially while you build out your team as you scale things up
  • Engineering Mindset - You see everything as a system, can easily identify all of its moving parts, how they relate in logic, time, sequence and function and use that insight to constantly optimize by removing constraints and capitalizing on opportunities with people, process and tech
  • Driven to Excellence - You've got an ownership mentality with an inner drive to excellence that other people who aren't built that way find disturbingly intense :-)
  • Exceptional Communication Skills - You're a perceptive listener, quickly synthesize info and can formulate a methodical action plan that can be clearly articulated verbally and in writing
  • Passion for Health, Fitness and Habits - An unquenchable thirst to improve your health and fitness with an intentional focus on constantly optimizing your daily habits and routines

Benefits

  • Health Care Plan (Medical, Dental & Vision)
  • Retirement Plan (401k, IRA)
  • Life Insurance (Basic, Voluntary & AD&D)
  • Unlimited Paid Time Off (Vacation, Sick & Public Holidays)
  • Family Leave (Maternity, Paternity)
  • Short Term & Long Term Disability
  • Training & Development
  • Work From Home
  • Wellness Resources

REACT DEVELOPER

Responsibilities:
  • Work closely with the development team and product owners to build code across the entire stack from React to Rails, including:

    • Developing full UI/UX for new customer-facing features in React/Redux

    • Adding APIs to the JSON/Rails backend when needed

    • Writing end-to-end tests, refactoring and improving code quality, scalability, performance and security.

    • Deploying code, monitoring operational performance, patching bugs, and when necessary rolling back problematic code.

    • Helping us to evolve our architecture to use the latest technologies (for example graphql+subscriptions, etc.)

  • Communicate effectively using your expertise, skills, and influence to help everyone on the team achieve even better results.
  • Participate in team meetings (such as our weekly ‚ÄúShow and Tell‚Äù meeting) and attend conferences as needed

  • Demonstrate an ownership mentality. We don‚Äôt hire people who just need a job. We hire people vested in the long-term performance and financial success of BidWrangler.

  • Develop your skills. Learn things you don‚Äôt already know; become even better at things that you do.

  • Learn about the auction industry. Understand BidWrangler‚Äôs customers, problems, and competitors.

Job details:
  • Full time position
  • Opportunity to work in our Harrisonburg, Va. office or remotely 

At BidWrangler, we embrace these core values: 

  • Treat customers like teammates and help them succeed.

  • Be a generous listener. 

  • Show empathy.

  • Have your team‚Äôs back in business and in life. 

  • Be honest, even if it means owning failure or facing fears. 

  • Find work that you are passionate about. 

  • Be curious and embrace change. 

If you are interested in this position, please send your resume to jobs@bidwrangler.com.

Job description

We are looking for a talented mid-level frontend developer with Shopify or B—ñgCommerce experience, willing to expand their skills for developing on these platforms.


What we offer

  • A long-term commitment

  • Salary range starting from $3000 up to $5600 USD

  • Several types of cooperation depending on your needs. You can choose from an hourly rate, flat fee, hourly rate with a guaranteed number of hours, and various perks and benefits.

  • A constant flow of amazing projects coming from start-ups, agencies, and companies mainly from the US, Australia, and the UK.

  • Working hours that best fit your schedule and the possibility to work from the comfort of your own home (an office in Krakow is also available for you).

  • Support for learning new skills and acquiring professional certifications.

Note: Our job ads are aimed at developers with strong overlap with CET timezone.


Requirements

General skills

  • You are able to deliver projects on time and at a high-quality level

  • You have a passion for development and continuous self-education

  • You have a consistent coding style and passion for well-organized, clean code

  • You have good verbal and written communication skills in English and you are not afraid to communicate with the clients directly during online meetings

Front-end development skills

  • Very good knowledge of HTML5, CSS3, Responsive Web Design, Performance Optimization, JavaScript & Accessibility.

  • Knowledge of at least one of the frameworks (Angular, React, Vue) is a plus.

  • Good knowledge of scalable and maintainable CSS methodologies (BEM, ITCSS) and CSS preprocessors: SCSS is preferred.

  • Basic aesthetics sense.

E-commerce development skills


Shopify

  • Experience with the Shopify platform and general experience with e-commerce.

  • Good knowledge of Shopify Liquid template language.

(or) BigCommerce

Recruitment process




This is how our recruitment process works:

  1. We will check your application to see if you would be a good fit to our team.

  2. If you pass the initial screening, we will invite you to do a quick front-end test project and an optional Shopify test.

  3. If you pass the challenge, we will invite you to a call interview focused on technical skills and knowledge, and soft-skills.

  4. If you pass the interview, you will become a member of Xfive. Congratulations!

Job description


ASG is seeking an experienced Digital Art Director to join our embedded team for a prominent global tech company client based in Mountain View to assist with the design of high-fidelity visuals and prototypes with a truly innovative UI team.

DURATION: 6 Month Fixed Term, with Full-Time Hours and Benefits with the Possibility of Extension.
LOCATION: Remote to Start, Possible Shift to Hybrid, Bay Area Preferred, PST Hours with Possible Onsite Collaboration Opportunities.

Tasks will include:
Working within a small, scrappy team of designers and researchers to iteratively improve user experience
Converting rough ideas into visual prototypes (i.e.: sketches, layout drafts, etc) to illustrate concepts for creative reviews
Taking new features from ideation/conception to prototyping and user testing
Effectively collaborating with a variety of other tech teams, such as Product, User Research, and Engineering
Converting broad, conceptual ideas into useful and valuable features using UX research, to enhance accessibility for all
Piloting concepts, design and execution of visual materials for integrated, cross-channel initiatives
Designing user flows, prototypes, and high-fidelity visuals for your features
Creating effective user experiences for the target audience using thorough UX user analytics
Continuously maintaining the aesthetic and visual identity of the brand that reflects the agency's core values and ideals
Providing input during team meetings to enhance features and concept ideas based on knowledge of current design trends, and themes
Leveraging user research to identify key ideas, feature updates, and design opportunities

Must have:
5+ years of Digital Product design experience overseeing key visual features
A strong overall design aesthetic and solid handling of 2D graphic design workflows
A solid portfolio highlighting your background with user experience principles and UI best practices
Working knowledge of creating wireframes and prototypes in Figma, as well as other related programs (i.e.: Sketch, Xd, inVision, Adobe Creative Suite; motion and video editing, etc.)
Knowledge of the usability testing process and experience interpreting/highlighting key test results that call for adjustments and corrections
A knack for problem diagnosis and creative problem solving
Strong organizational skills to manage multiple tasks within time and budget constraints
An ability to communicate clearly, thoroughly and succinctly while responding to comments, suggestions, and criticisms in a constructive manner
Strong presentation skills; presents creative work succinctly and effectively
The ability to anticipate potential problems and obstacles to project success, communicates concerns, and develops solutions

Technical and Program Knowledge:
Must have a working knowledge of the most common UI/UX design programs such as Figma and the full Adobe Creative Cloud suite

Nice to have:
Agency experience
A general understanding of capabilities and limitations of front end technologies (i.e.: CSS, HTML, and JavaScript)

Above all else, you have:
The ability to effectively communicate and collaborate with a diverse range of people and job functions, clients, and agencies
Respect for complete confidentiality on all business matters
Strong proficiency with Google Suite (i.e.: email, calendars, spreadsheets)

Remote work is one of the great equalizers of our time, allowing people to secure employment opportunities from companies around the world, no matter where they were born or where they live. Omnipresent does just that.

We are a customer-focused global employment services partner that can help companies grow their teams in 155 countries and territories around the world. How do we do that? Well, through our SaaS platform, OmniPlatform. We help companies (big or small) deal with the complexities involved with hiring global teams remotely, by managing employee onboarding through to offboarding, including legal and compliance, payroll, expenses, and health and benefits.

We also practice what we preach! We are a fully remote company which means we have no head office. Our team of more than 150 people is located in more than 35 countries and territories around the world. This means you can work from anywhere. We provide benefits and support in any global location just as we would for our clients and their remote teams. Our company has a flat structure which means accountability and taking initiative towards your everyday tasks that help further our ambitious company goals.

At a time when remote work is exploding, we're growing our team to help make global remote work a reality for people everywhere.

More about Engineering at Omnipresent

The engineering and product teams work very closely together to form empowered teams with shared KPIs, that include Subject Matter Experts from other departments in Omnipresent (when that makes sense). Each team decides how it works for itself, and teams have a mix of approaches that vary based on their preferences, the needs of their users and the specifics of the work they are doing. Engineers interact frequently with our internal customers, and occasionally with external ones, to understand what they need from the software, get their feedback on what is being built and work with them directly if something goes wrong.

We have maintained an emphasis on technical quality as we grow - ensuring that our software remains refactorable, and is refactored, as we build - so we can maintain a high pace of delivery over time. We have high levels of automated test coverage, a very fast release cycle, and consider refactoring part of the work. We are working on improving the availability of slack time in the team so we can deliver more "quick win" improvements to the product and technology.


Requirements

Your role

Omnipresent is looking for experienced Engineers to help bring our customer and internal facing OmniPlatform to life. We are solving an incredibly complex problem and need the customer interface to be beautiful and usable. This involves building both a highly performant frontend application and a mesh of backend services which abstract the complex country specific elements and surface the required data to the frontend.

  • You would be joining a fast-growing distributed team of engineers, who work cross-functionally with Product and Design to build the OmniPlatform, solve problems and support the needs of our global customers. We write our tests first, and know that delivering quickly requires excellent tooling and ongoing attention to the health of the codebase (React/Redux/NodeJS/Typescript and many more fancy technologies which we selected to solve given problem)
  • You will be working with the JS Stack, Github integrated with Circle CI, event driven system, collaborative teams and guilds. We are currently working with TypeScript but we are open for people with experience in modern web technologies and an eagerness to learn new frameworks
  • You are open for new ideas and willing to discuss different points of view
  • You collaborate on a daily basis with product managers, design, and other internal stakeholders to ensure we are building a product that solves our customer needs
  • You contribute to our tooling and automation
  • You work asynchronously with a distributed team, so you will be creating durable written artifacts of your work
  • You have 3+ years of experience

Feature development, technical improvements and tooling are all first class citizens when we prioritize. Our engineers have an active voice in planning work, make smart trade-offs between short and long term value, and can demonstrate how the work they want to do will benefit our customers later.

The Team

  • We are a truly omnipresent and fully remote engineering team located in many countries of Europe, Africa, Central Asia and both Americas.
  • We work closely with our internal stakeholders to truly understand the problem we need to solve
  • We are transparent about our technology stack - you can learn more about it here: https://stackshare.io/omnipresent/omnipresent
  • We are curious about how we can help improve our products
  • We are curious about you


What would make you really stand out?

  • Experience in JS, specifically typescript, Node and React
  • Experience with AWS and/or security,
  • Experience in an environment that uses DevOps, Modern Testing and/or Modern Agile practices

Benefits

What else is in it for you?

  • Interesting work and complex challenges: Being part of the founding team means this is greenfield work. You'll decide the future of the tech stack and be fundamental to our success.
  • Shared ownership - Being a part of our journey means you will own a piece of Omnipresent
  • Annual vacation entitlement: 33 days including local holidays
  • Equipment and infrastructure: We give you a budget for all the equipment you need to work effectively wherever you are
  • Company retreats: We are planning biannual company-wide retreats post COVID, and well as socials and other team building activities
  • Coworking space access: We offer all employees access to co-working spaces where ever they live in a flexible manner so that you use what you need.
  • Development should be a continuous conversation with your manager and they will support you in choosing what you need whether that's accreditations, workshops, or formal degree programs or courses. Important is that you update your Individual Development Plan with any kind of education you take.
  • Working with an innovative and rapidly growing startup team
  • Flexible working - Work from anywhere in the world. We are as flexible as the work allows
  • Start date: Mutually agreed as soon as possible

We believe remote working is a great equaliser and we practice what we preach. Inclusivity is fundamental to our mission and we are committed to conscious inclusion. We believe in the potential of everyone; regardless of race, religion or belief, ethnic origin, different physical ability, family structure, socio-economics, age, nationality or citizenship, marital, domestic or civil partnership status, sexual orientation, or gender identity.

Ethyca (https://ethyca.com) is a high-growth Series A remote startup on a mission to make Trust, Respect and Privacy a default feature of every tech stack. To accomplish this, we created the Fides open source language for data privacy (https://ethyca.com/fides/) and its related suite of free developer tools to enforce privacy policies as code, automate users‚Äô right to access and erase their data, and much more. We believe software engineers are uniquely equipped to solve modern privacy challenges, but only if we work together on shared standards and best practice tools - come join our team and help make this a reality!

As a developer-first company, engineering is an integral part of everything at Ethyca. On our rapidly growing Engineering team, you‚Äôll be making decisions that have a significant impact on the product and company. You‚Äôll have the opportunity to learn from our team, our customers, and our community: all of which happen to include some of the best privacy engineers in the world. You‚Äôll work with a wide variety of technologies and design APIs and features that are rapidly deployed to solve complex data privacy problems at scale.

Our open source teams are responsible for maintaining the Fides developer tools (e.g. fideslang, fidesctl, fidesops) that bring privacy best practices directly into the software engineering development process. As a member of the core team, you will be a full-time contributor to these open source projects and can work on features across the stack depending on your strengths: integrating with databases, designing APIs, writing documentation, or engaging with our growing community on issues and PRs.

Responsibilities
  • Build, test, and release high-quality open source software to the world
  • Ensure high-quality standards for code, testing, documentation, etc.
  • Anticipate problems and proactively suggest architecture to stay ahead
  • Work autonomously on large software projects that deliver on shared goals
  • Collaborate with your team and the community to write technical specs, plan projects, and document your work
  • Provide community support and help troubleshoot complex issues quickly and thoroughly

Requirements
  • 4+ years experience writing production-grade web applications or services
  • Expertise with Python 3, web frameworks (e.g. Django, Flask, FastAPI), and RESTful APIs
  • Proficient with one or more data stores such as MySQL, Postgres, MongoDB, Snowflake, etc.
  • Fluent with automated testing frameworks (unit, integration, E2E) and CI/CD tools (e.g. GitLab, GitHub)
  • Love writing tests for everything you do
  • Some examples of contributing to or maintaining open source projects is a plus
  • Previous experience working independently in a high velocity environment where rapid iteration is vital (like a startup!)
  • Excellent written communication skills and a love for documentation and collaboration
  • Experienced working in an asynchronous environment like an open source project or distributed team
  • Comfortable with agile processes and best practices (but not doctrine!)

Benefits
  • Competitive cash and equity compensation
  • 100% medical and dental insurance coverage
  • Remote-friendly core office hours (10 - 2 ET) and vacation policy
  • Sponsored company lunches and events
  • Parental leave and 401K plan

We are an equal opportunity employer and are committed to diversity, equity, and inclusion. We do not discriminate on race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, disability status, or any other protected characteristics.

Ethyca is a distributed team with headquarters in NYC and remote workers across the US. When it‚Äôs safe to meet again, you‚Äôll have the opportunity to travel to NYC a few times a year for company events. We are currently unable to sponsor visas, so we do require that you are authorized to work in the USA.

We‚Äôre a data privacy company building a missing piece of the Internet‚Äôs infrastructure: the trust layer that empowers users and businesses to manage data respectfully. Every day, we‚Äôre solving challenges for customers and thinking about the future of human rights as society increasingly moves online. If this sounds intriguing and you‚Äôre excited to shape that future with us, we‚Äôd love to talk to you!

We‚Äôre looking for an experienced React developer to join our team and build some of our most valuable projects and partnerships.

We‚Äôre looking for: * An experienced React dev. * Strong knowledge of web fundamentals: HTML/CSS, responsive web dev. * At least 1-2 years of React experience. * You‚Äôve built and launched some great apps. * A natural learner who loves diving into new platforms and frameworks. * A good communicator who‚Äôs comfortable talking in a client meeting, demo'ing your work, teaching another developer something you learned, and advocating internally for your own ideas.

Every week you‚Äôll be: * Designing and building new features for React and React Native apps. * Working with the rest of our team to determine priorities for projects and managing your own schedule. * Learning new platforms and frameworks.

Pay & Benefits

This position‚Äôs base salary range is $70-100k. We offer fully paid parental leave and 3 weeks (15 days) of vacation time per year. We match up to 6% of your 401k contributions. We subsidize coworking or home office expenses. We cover 100% of your medical, dental, and vision insurance premium, as well as covering 50% of costs for your spouse and depenents.

Job description

The Johnson & Johnson (J&J) Medical Devices Industrial Design & Human Factors (IDHF) organization is seeking an exceptional multidimensional UX/UI designer that has a passion for designing holistic systems that create a unified user experience across both digital and physical assets. Our global Design and Human Factors team focuses specifically on advancing the needs of the Healthcare Industry by placing our users at the center of our design process. We design solutions that span the full episode of care and balance the needs of various users, surgeons, hospital staff, patients and caregivers. Our team is comprised of Industrial Designers, Human Factors Engineers, UX/Interaction Designers, Information Designers and Design Strategists in over seven locations around the world. Our team partners with R&D and Marketing to create innovative human-centered design solutions that have the global reach to change the lives of billions of people around the world and profoundly change the trajectory of health for humanity.

As a UX/UI designer on our team, you will be expected to execute and evangelize best in class UX/UI design solutions, work alongside other UX/UI designers or independently. Our designers collaborate and partner across all phases of the design journey from needs definition through ensuring design intent is maintained through launch. Our team environment is collaborative, diverse, supporting and committed to harnessing the power of design embedded with superb usability to improve the quality of people‚Äôs lives while changing the trajectory of healthcare.


Qualifications

BS/BA Degree in User Experience Design, Human-Computer Interaction Design, Industrial Design or a similar relevant field.
Minimum 2 years‚Äô experience in UX/UI product development is required
Experience participating in activities such as; competitive UX benchmarking, generative wireframing to determine context hierarchy based on user workflow, composing compelling visual storyboards, developing mid to high fidelity UX prototypes for both physical and/or digital assets, conducting user testing and partnering to generate product animations highly preferred

Job description

DePuy Synthes is seeking a UX Design to Business Strategist, based in Raynham, MA

DePuy Synthes, part of the Johnson & Johnson Medical Devices Companies, provides one of the most comprehensive orthopedics portfolios in the world. DePuy Synthes solutions, in specialties including joint reconstruction, trauma, craniomaxillofacial, spinal surgery and sports medicine, are designed to advance patient care while delivering clinical and economic value to health care systems worldwide. For more information, visit www.depuysynthes.com

In line with our dedication to our CREDO J&J offers excellent employee benefits including excellent health care, family leave, and retirement planning.

The role which is in the Medical Devices Design and Human Factors organization (IDHF). We are seeking a multi-faceted, exceptionally talented, user-centered Design to Business Strategist who is passionate about changing the trajectory of healthcare through transformational user experiences.

Our IDHF team has been an embedded partner of J&J Medical Devices since 1988 and we have been honored to have garnered numerous prestigious industry awards for our commitment to human centered design and improving the quality of healthcare experiences for HCP‚Äôs and patients.

Our global design team leverages Human Centered Design (HCD) philosophies to advance the needs of the MedTech Industry by placing our users at the center of our design process. We design solutions that span the full episode of care and balance the needs of various users; surgeons, hospital staff, patients, and caregivers along the journey through cohesive designs (physical and digital) across our portfolio.

Our organization is a multinational team comprised of Industrial Designers, Human Factors Engineers, UX/Interaction Designers, Information Designers and Design Strategists in more than nine locations around the world, all operating under the same mission to improve the quality of care.

Key Responsibilities:

Create compelling new value propositions to enhance the holistic user experience based on user research, Novel IP, and market insights.
Translate market and/or research insights into potential business opportunities that create new products and / or service offerings that deliver value for our users.
Integrate Physical, Digital, and Service design into a holistic user experience.
Partner with design colleagues and cross-functional partners to shape the development of products and businesses that lead to disruptive growth.
Define appropriate UX metrics related to business KPI‚Äôs that translate to and inform UX learning plans.
Partner to design research plans that uncover user needs, motivations, and attitudinal beliefs for product adoption and compliance across the full care continuum between our various user groups.
Support competitive portfolio analyses to define unique UX differentiators.
Conduct trend analysis (e.g., experiences, demographic, consumer, technology, healthcare, economics, etc.) to shape internal strategies.
Evangelize HCD and UX by creating engaging narratives that bring to life these opportunities through compelling storytelling and data visualization techniques.

Qualifications
Education:

A minimum of a Bachelor's degree in UX Design, Service Design, Innovation, Psychology, Industrial Design, or Business Strategy is required. An MBA or Advanced degree is preferred.
Required Skills:

6 years or more of relevant work experience within human centered design, user experience and research, product market research and/or development.
Experience in developing and evangelizing design to business strategies with solid business acumen and rationalizations.
Experience synthesizing market insights and user feedback into concise, meaningful proposals and action plans.
Excellent verbal and written communicator with data / information visualization skills to create visually appealing proposals and analyses.
Preferred Skills:

Experience with systems thinking.
Experience with identifying, defining, and using methodologies to measure user experience metrics.
Medical Device industry experience.
Other:

This role is based in Raynham, MA and required the ability to travel up to 20%, domestic and international is required.


Johnson & Johnson is an Affirmative Action and Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, age, national origin, or protected veteran status and will not be discriminated against on the basis of disability.

The Giving Block is a venture capital-backed company that makes it easy for nonprofits to accept donations in cryptocurrencies like Bitcoin, while offering donors a more tax-efficient way to support their favorite projects. We are the market-leading provider and work with over 1300 nonprofits, including large organizations like United Way Worldwide and the American Cancer Society. We are well on our way to raising over $100 million in crypto donations for our clients and will continue to grow rapidly in 2022.

Our goal is to make accepting cryptocurrency donations as easy as paying by credit card. Help us empower nonprofits around the world with the ability to accept cryptocurrency donations to unlock an exciting new wave of funding and accelerate their missions!

Summary Description

We have more projects on our roadmap than ever before and are ramping up our development efforts once again. The candidate will have the opportunity to participate in the development of our core technology and integrate it with nonprofits, industry-leading crypto products, and our ecosystem partners. As with most startups, your work will vary from day to day, so no two days will be the same. If it's a good fit, you will have the opportunity to take on leadership roles. 

Key technologies we use: TypeScript, Node.js, AWS, PostgreSQL, Redis, koa, joi, awilix, Swagger, Docker, Git, the frontend is based on React.js.

Here are some examples of the work you will be doing every day:

  • Designing, building and maintaining end-to-end backend services using TypeScript, Node.js and our company's framework.
  • Writing well-structured, maintainable, and efficient code along with unit tests.
  • Integrations with third-party APIs, development of our public API.
  • Research and analyze epic tasks and collaborate with the product team.
  • Ensure security and quality of backend services as we deal with our client's money.
  • Provide production support, troubleshooting and bug fixing.
  • Storage layer: design DB schema, SQL query writing, query performance analysis.
  • Collaborate with the development team, QAs and product team on system improvements and selection of tools and technologies, code review.
  • Assist the team in creating and maintaining tech documentation.

We require

  • 4+ years of experience as a back-end developer with at least 2-3 recent years of experience with NodeJS
  • Experience with TypeScript
  • You are skilled in SQL databases, OOP, SOLID, system design, design patterns and GRASP
  • A thorough understanding of writing secure code and an awareness of common security vulnerabilities in web applications
  • Strong communication skills in English 

We count as a plus

  • Knowledge of PostgreSQL, cloud providers (AWS, Google Cloud), message queue (RabbitMQ, AWS SQS, Kafka), Docker
  • You have designed and developed web services or/and done integrations with third party APIs
  • Experience in production support (troubleshooting, bug fixing)
  • Interest in blockchain, cryptocurrencies, and/or non-profits

What we offer

  • Competitive compensation (salary, benefits, equity, etc.)
  • Three weeks of paid vacation and 10+ company-wide holidays
  • Flexible work location and hours (fully remote)
  • Company issued laptop and equipment
  • We work with agile methodologies without unnecessary bureaucracy
  • No legacy code and no significant tech debt 

We‚Äôre building the future of giving.  Join us in creating positive change through innovative technology!
